title: QAエンジニアリングチーム
description: ポジション名 QAエンジニアリングチーム職務内容既存の自動化フレームワークとマニュアルテストリポジトリのテストの作成、更新、維持 1 of 2 page(s) QAチーム内外の問題、欠陥、明確化の作成と更新のフォローアップ 回帰テストを実行し、標準化された方法でオンデマンドで結果を追跡する。 チームによって作成されたテストの要件トレーサビリティを確保する。QAスプリントミーティングに参加し、テスト活動の計画および優先順位付けを行う。常に学習し、チーム内の改善を提案する資格1つまたは複数の高級言語（例：Scala、Python、Ruby、...）を使用したテスト経験がある。APIベースの金融システムのテスト経験 クラウドベースの環境での作業経験ベストプラクティスを学び、教える意欲のある方 問題を発見すること、または問題を予測することに情熱を注げる方 新しいことを学ぶのが好きで、どんな解決策も恐れずサポートできる方 テストによる正しさだけでなく、ベンチマークによるパフォーマンスにも関心がある方 ビジネスレベルの英語力 日本語ネイティブレベルの会話、文章、読解力会社概要 当グループは、インドに本社を置くグローバル企業です。グループは、「Leadership with Trustに基づく長期的なステークホルダーの価値創造を通じて、グローバルにサービスを提供する地域社会の生活の質を向上させること」を使命として、6大陸100カ国以上で事業を展開しています。プロモーター持株会社であるサンズ社の株式の66％は慈善信託によって保有されており、それによって社会に富を還元しています。強い価値観とビジネス倫理を守り、150年にわたりインドで尊敬を集めている企業名です。グループ各社は、倫理と誠実さの文化によって強化された、最良の人材を採用しています。今日、私たちは702,454人の従業員を抱え、力強く立っています。

title: コマースＣＤＯオフィス：データアナリスト(OGOMD)
description: Job Description楽天・事業について楽天グループは、イノベーションを通じて、人々と社会をエンパワーメントすることをミッションに、幅広いサービスを展開。コマースカンパニーは、楽天市場/楽天トラベル/物流/ラクマなど30以上のサービスを展開しており、楽天グループの中核のカンパニーです。部署・サービスについてコマースCDOオフィスは、コマースカンパニーにおける、データ戦略策定とデータ資産の活用、事業サポートによる収益貢献、データ関連の人材育成をMissionとした組織になっています。また、コマースカンパニーPresident直下の組織として、コマースカンパニーTech役員であるコマースカンパニーCDOのもと、活動しています。日本有数のECサイトの1つである楽天市場をはじめ、様々なサービスをデータ活用の面からサポートする非常にやりがいのある部署です。ポジション：募集背景コマースカンパニーにおけるデータ活用の更なる推進に向けて、部署の体制を強化すべく、増員を計画しています。業務内容・各事業の分析サポート（マーケティング効果予測や測定、VOC分析、KPI測定の自動更新化等）・各事業の分析に関するナレッジマネージメントの仕組化・各事業の分析者教育なお、楽天グループ内のデータエンジニアやサイエンティストと連携をするなどして、データに関して様々な刺激を受けつつ、多くのことを学ぶことが出来ます。働く環境20ー30代の若手中心で、専任メンバー数名の小さい組織です。リーダー候補・メンバーともに募集しております。事業会社マーケティング部門でのデータ活用に関する企画・推進や、SIerのデータアナリスト必須要件：・社会人経験3年以上・SQLとBIツールの利用経験（BIツール不問）・データ分析の経験、もしくはデータ分析に関わる企業や部署の勤務経験・課題解決・戦略的思考・構造化思考・仮説設計の能力（業務要件や顧客要件の課題整理を行えるレベル）歓迎要件：・ビッグデータやAI（機械学習、ディープラーニング）に関わるプロジェクト経験・ビジネスインテリジェンス、および、統計・機械学習ツール(SPSSやDataRobotなど)の導入・管理・活用経験・EC事業経験・コミュニケーション力に富み、リーダーシップを発揮し、チームで成果を出せる方・変化に柔軟に対応しながら、新しいことを吸収する意欲のある前向きな方・責任感が強く、自ら主体となって最後までやりきる力のある方・自ら課題を発見し、解決していく前向きな姿勢のある方その他：英語要件に関する補足TOEIC 800点以上（もしくは同程度の英語力を保有している資格の証明、英語圏の大卒以上の学位証明ができること）ただし、TOEIC600点以上があれば契約社員として入社可。入社後に800点取得を目指していただきます。内定通知のタイミングまでには資格の証明が必要です。スコアをお持ちでない、もしくは証明書が無い方は、選考過程で弊社主催のTOEIC IPテストをご案内いたします。#ビジネス職 #jobcategory01 #データアナリスト #jobsubcategory05 #コマースカンパニー #organization01 #楽天市場 #servicename01 #楽天トラベル #servicename11 #ラクマ #servicename08LanguagesEnglish (総合 - 3 - 上級)、 Japanese (総合 - 4 - 流暢)

title: データサイエンティスト
description: 【仕事内容】同社のデータサイエンティストとして、下記の業務をご担当いただきます。■海外委託：海外委託先（台湾、中国、ドイツ）開発、量産監視業務に伴う、技術折衝、定期マネージメント会議開催■データサイエンス：半導体生産品の歩留り改善や素子特性安定化の業務に伴う、データサイエンス業務。＜具体的には＞■海外委託・採用時の想定ポジション：ビジネス経験と英会話力による・入社から1年程度での想定業務：半導体委託エンジニアの全体像の把握、開発～量産の要求事項理解・入社から2~3年で、海外委託先と主体的にコミニケーション、定期的なFace to face打ち合わせ、出張■ データサイエンス・採用時の想定ポジション：経験による（プログラミング力、ビッグデータの統計処理力）・入社から1年程度での想定業務：会社が目指すデータサイエンスを用いたあるべき姿の理解・入社から2~3年での業務イメージ：反復的な業務をモデリング、プログラミングを用いてタスクを自動化、見える化【2～3年後のキャリアパス】■ 海外委託：海外委託先のエンジニアと密にコミニケーショ...【求める人材】【必須要件】■ビジネスレベルの英語力（TOEIC 800点以上）■統計学、統計処理経験者（社会人経験2年以上）【歓迎要件】■ビジネスレベルの中国語力■ビジネスでの統計学、統計処理経験者【給与】450-900万円【勤務地】長崎県【勤務時間】08:30 - 17:30（コアタイム：09:30 - 15:30）【雇用・契約形態】【待遇・福利厚生】健康保険、雇用保険、労災保険、厚生年金通勤手当、時間外手当退職金、財形貯蓄、社員持株、社員食堂、ソニー製品購入クーポン券の支給やソニーグループ内の生命保険・損害保険に社員価格で加入することが可能、各テクノロジーセンターにはカフェテリアを完備【休日・休暇】年間126日／（内訳）完全週休2日制（土日祝）、夏季休暇、年末年始、個人別休日（年間休日の中には、会社休日以外で個人が自由に設定できる休日）

title: GCS Senior Analyst - Data/Platform
description: DescriptionYou Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.American Express is a leading global payments, network, and travel company, backed by one of the world's most recognized brands. American Express is unique in the payments industry as an issuer of cards as well as a worldwide network that processes millions of merchant transactions daily. We offer the broadest array of charge, credit, prepaid and co brand cards for consumers, small businesses, midsize companies, large corporations, and many of the biggest companies in the world. With 160 years of innovation behind us, our future could not look more promising. We're moving faster than ever and introducing new products, services, and strategies to bring greater value to our business customers. Their success expands our success, so we put heart and soul into helping them achieve results that exceed all expectations.Global Commercial Services (GCS) is a core operating group of American Express and has delivered robust growth over the past decade. GCS partners with commercial clients to help them manage travel expenses and make purchases through proprietary payment solutions and expense management tools.This position is responsible to manage/enhance GCS sales & account development (AD) platforms mainly from data perspective. The most important task of this position is to ensure that the sales tools used by the sales force store the correct and accurate data. To this end, if there is any error data due to system issue or user operations, appropriate action is taken immediately. Since the platforms are connected to many systems, you need to work with the right team to take appropriate action depending on the situation. In addition, you work with different sales &AD teams in support of projects both big and small. You perform a versatile role, including project support, inquiry handling, communications. You have the latitude to work in-depth on projects/initiatives that support the goals of the team. Able to achieve a purpose with ingenuity under given system conditions. Such as quickly verifying a large amount of data under limited environment. Possesses deep technical expertise in one or two technology domains. Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, oral/presentation and written communication skills in both technical and non-technical language. Demonstrates strong leadership, project and team building skills – ability to lead teams and drive projects and initiatives by working effectively with others. Demonstrates ability to deliver solutions under tight timelines with minimal supervision. Ability to manage, build consensus and bring focus in a cross-functional environment. Demonstrates ability to influence with credibility across business functions or technologies with analysis. Good communication skills for both in Japanese and English languagesQualifications Ability to have algorithmic thinking Familiar with the handling of millions of data records 3+ years of coding and programming experience Work experience working in a technical area Experience or knowledge of computer systems, software engineering toolsOffer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

title: Data Engineer
description: Company ProfileA rare fintech start-up is pioneering and leading an unprecedented, unique peer-to-peer lending ecosystem with the mission to spread trust throughout society and give people room to dream. They incorporate proprietary models and machine learning into their transactions and have partnered with global leading payment services to make shopping easier both online and offline. At the backbone of all data-related activities sits data management, where you - a key member of the data engineering team - will contribute to the efficiency of data pipelines, building and maintaining them for critical reports that keeps the business running.The RoleConsult with business stakeholders on reporting needs, collect requirements, document report background and technical specification. Work with the same stakeholders to collect feedback on report contents.Conduct ad-hoc analysis to confirm requirements and important report metrics definitions, often working together with analysts in credit risk and/or data science. Identify, investigate, and solve data discrepancies in reports.Design and document ETL pipelines and data structures upstream from the final generated reports. Find ways to optimize the ETL in the pipeline and adjust data models/ structures upstream to increase flexibility, efficiency, or easy of achieving high accuracy in reportsMonitor report generation, provide first line support for any issues with deployed reporting pipelines and generated reportsWorking with data scientists, design and deploy BI tool dashboards to add value to reporting pipelines for stakeholders (we use Looker)Contribute to data lake/warehouse development and other data integration projectsYour SkillsA Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related subject3+ year experience in data engineering or software development of data-intensive applicationsStrong skills in Python, Git, Docker, SQL, some ETL tool / job orchestration tool such as Airflow or Prefect (we use Prefect), ETL pipelines.Knowledge and experience with either Scala or Java a huge plusKnowledge and experience with Apache Spark a plusExperience on financial/accounting products or services, in particular technical implementation impact and considerationCreative Problem-solving skills, a passion for programming and solving problems with codeLocationTokyo 23 wardsSalary7 - 10 mil yenSelling pointsFlexible working styleInternational environmentCompetitive SalaryPartnered with global leading payment serviceAccess to vast amount of dataReference number : 06940-0012261834

title: データサイエンティスト
description: 会社概要：世界トップクラスの規模を誇る総合人材サービス企業の日本法人です。業務内容：各事業部門と連携したDX戦略の策定DXプロジェクトのマネジメントIT部門と連携したデータ分析基盤の設計/開発/運営統計/機械学習等を用いる各種プロジェクトへの参画特に全社横断で進めるDXプロジェクトにおいて、高い技術専門性を活かして、技術開発を担っていただける方DXプロジェクトにおける統計/機械学習/自然言語処理等の技術開発各種プロジェクトへの技術支援（技術設計のレビュー）社内人財の育成応募条件：データ利活用またはit利活用プロジェクトの実務経験（3～5年）分析実務システム開発実務サービス・アプリケーションへのデプロイ 育成体制・研修内容:社内開発のデータサイエンティスト育成研修メンター制による直接指導研究の企画・設計複数メンバー/複数機関を含む研究チームマネジメント 以下いずれかのご経験をお持ちの方:データ利活用またはIT利活用プロジェクトの実務経験研究の企画・設計や複数メンバー/複数機関を含む研究チームマネジメント

title: データサイエンティスト
company: 株式会社ネクストビート
description: 【仕事内容】【職務概要】同社が展開する事業領域・バックオフィス業務において、業務システム（Salesforce等）やGoogle Analytics、各種アプリで取得したデータをもとに、データの分析・分析結果にもとづいた業務改善をリード頂きます。【職務詳細】データ収集・加工や、機械学習エンジニアリングといったデータサイエンティストの中核の業務はもちろん、業務部門と連携した課題・目的設定や、分析設計、結果を踏まえた報告、アクションのサポートなど業務全体に関わっていきます。また、全社でのデータ利活用を進めるために、データマネジメントの推進やデータ見える化の実装、保育データを活用した社内外への情報発信など、お持ちのスキルやチャレンジしたい分野に合わせて業務領域も拡大可能です。チームでは、データサイエンスの実務経験・マネジメント経験が豊富なリーダーと連携しながらも大きな裁量をもって、仕事を進めていくことが可能です。■言語／フレームワーク等：データ加工・分析：SQL（BigQuery）／Python分析基盤構築：Google Cloud開発支援：GitHub Enterprise, Redash, Slack, JIRA, Confluence ／ IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate 選択可 …【求める人材】【必須】・SQL、Pythonによるビッグデータの加工・Python等によるビッグデータの分析、機械学習の実施・自他部署・他社において、業務上の課題を発見しデータを用いて解決した経験【尚可】・Google Analyticsおよびそのデータを用いた分析・TableauなどのBI構築・社内外のプロジェクトを推進した経験【給与】年収:700万～1200万程度年俸制：-給与:■経験、スキル、年齢を考慮の上、同社規定により優遇賞与:有昇給:年2回【勤務地】【本社】〒150-0013東京都渋谷区恵比寿4丁目9番10号JR山手線「恵比寿」駅より徒歩5分日比谷線「恵比寿」駅より徒歩7分【勤務時間】10時00分～19時00分（実労働時間8時間）【雇用・契約形態】正社員契約期間：無期試用期間：3ヵ月【待遇・福利厚生】交通費支給（上限あり）、家事代行利用補助制度、病児保育補助制度、昼活（健康的な昼食を無料で提供）、グロービスeMBA受講制度、ビジネス書籍購入制度、プログラミングWEB講義の費用負担制度、ベンチャープログラム（入社半年以上の社員なら誰でも新規事業の立案が可能）、資格取得支援など喫煙情報：屋内原則禁煙（喫煙室あり）【休日・休暇】完全週休2日制（土・日・祝）、有給休暇 、夏季休暇 （特別休暇として3日付与）、年末年始休暇 、慶弔休暇、産前産後休暇、育児休暇、アニバーサリー休暇

title: 【Up to 11mil/year】Business System Analyst
description: Good opportunity to take up more responsibility|Tech lead, PMO, senior developers are more than welcome to apply!About Our ClientOur client is a global leader in digital transformation, consulting, technology and engineering services offering a broad spectrum of opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms to their customers.With the aim to disrupt the relevant industries, our client has over 250,000 team members being involved in contemporary technology to satisfy their customer's needs. On top of that, the current digital era, services that will take months now can be done in weeks by our client.Job DescriptionLiaise with business owners and IT leaders within client organization on weekly / monthly basis to ensure IT deliveries meet project goals, vision and reflect true voice of customerAnalyze and document business requirements for business requests while using industry standard analysis techniques such as UML or data flow modeling, workflow analysis, functional decomposition analysis and business rule definition.Conceptualize the solution framework and prepare the business specification documents. Set up review meetings for documents requiring approvalKnowledge transition to the development team for the proposed requirementCollaborate across business and technology functions to ensure comprehensive business solutions are implementedThe Successful ApplicantBusiness level Japanese and EnglishExperience in business requirements definitionExperience in analyzing complex business, data and technology issues to support decision makingGood communication skills, experience in client-facingWhat's on OfferWorking in an international environmentChance to work for one of the top software companyFast recruitment processExperienced candidates will be considered for senior rolesContact: Toshiyuki IsatoQuote job ref: JN-052022-5606069

title: データプラットフォーム部 : BIデータアナリスト (DPD)
description: Job Description 楽天・事業について 楽天グループは日本に約 1億人、世界中で10億人の顧客基盤を抱え、電子商取引、決済サービス、金融サービス、通信、メディア、スポーツなど、70以上のサービスを提供しています。 部署・サービスについて 「楽天はデータ駆動型のメンバーシップ企業である」という戦略的ビジョンを掲げ、楽天グループ各社横断でデータ活用の取り組みを拡大しています。 我々は社内のデータウェアハウスを活用したBIサービスを楽天グループ内の各ビジネスユーザに提供しています。 募集背景 社内データ活用の取り組みを より強化するため、弊社データプラットフォーム部で働くためのデータアナリストを募集いたします。 業務内容 このポジションは BI開発チームに所属しデータ分析のサポートを行います。BI開発チームと共に活動し、新規案件のユーザへの提案や、開発レポートから得られる知見について考察を行い、ユーザへ提供します。 社内に は多種多様な ビジネス部が存在しており、各ビジネス要件を理解し、インサイトを提供することが求められます。＜担当業務＞・要件定義 ： 各ビジネス部の要件をヒアリングし、データ分析のオプションについてユーザに提案する。・ BIレポートの分析 ： BI開発者と協力し、開発レポートから得られる知見について考察を行う。・ユーザへのコンサルテーション ： BIレポートから得られる知見についてユーザへのプレゼンテーション、コンサルテーションを行う。 必須要件： ・ データ分析やデータ活用によるビジネスバリュー向上への興味、理解・ データ分析を専門とする会社または組織の在籍経験・ データ分析ツール、ソリューション活用のスキル（SQL、Python、R、BIツール等）・3年以上のIT業務経験 歓迎要件： ・ 統計学 /計量経済学 等の学士以上保有または同等の資格保有・ ビジネス要件を理解するための基本的知識 （会計、マーケティング用語等の知識）・ 3年以上のデータ分析組織の在籍経験・ エグゼクティブコミュニケーション/プレゼンテーションの経験・ 海外のメンバとのビジネス経験#ビジネス職#business#データサイエンティスト #データアナリスト#リサーチャー#datascientist#researcher#テクノロジーサービスディビジョン#technologyservicediv#PythonLanguagesEnglish (総合 - 3 - 上級)、 Japanese (総合 - 3 - 上級)

title: Customer Data Analyst
description: SDG&E is an innovative San Diego-based energy company that provides clean, safe and reliable energy to better the lives of the people it serves in San Diego and southern Orange counties. The company is committed to creating a sustainable future by providing its electricity from renewable sources; modernizing natural gas pipelines; accelerating the adoption of electric vehicles; supporting numerous non-profit partners; and, investing in innovative technologies to ensure the reliable operation of the region’s infrastructure for generations to come. SDG&E is a subsidiary of Sempra Energy (NYSE: SRE).Our highly trained and responsive employees with their diverse skills, talents and ideas are the reason we can deliver on our commitment and are building America’s best energy company. They are also the reason why we have been recognized with the industry’s most coveted awards. Our employees undertake challenging work, and receive highly competitive compensation and benefits. As one of the region’s largest employers, we’re always searching for talented and bright people to join our team. After all, it takes the best to build the best. Learn more about benefits HERE.Diversity and inclusion are core values of SDG&E. Empowering our employees to be their whole selves at work is our competitive advantage. This is where new ideas come from and meaningful collaboration gets an authentic start. By bringing together people with different perspectives, diverse backgrounds and real commitment to their own individuality, we have built a stronger business. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion HERE.For more information, visit SDGEnews.com or connect with SDG&E on Twitter (@SDGE), Instagram (@SDGE) and Facebook.Primary PurposeThis position serves as an important resource for data- based insights related to customers. Responsible for querying data, and providing meaningful displays of findings to support customer facing areas such as marketing, outreach and communication, in order to aid in their understanding of diverse customer population and their engagement with our services/programs. Utilizes querying and data manipulation techniques to acquire data from various siloed databases for various purposes, such as supporting communications with customers and key performance reporting. Provides information relevant to customer targeting and campaign effectiveness, as well as other relevant customer metrics, and collaborates across departments in order to align data presentment and other outcomes with client data needs.Duties And ResponsibilitiesUtilizes advanced data manipulation techniques while extracting, querying, transforming and loading data as needed in support of various reporting and analysis needs.Performs data analysis of information gathered, and develop recommendations/actions to be taken based on the applicable information. Analyzes data/information and creates data visualization, reporting and presentation of insights developed through the analysis.Acts as a point of contact with a wide range of clients regarding business problems as they relate to analytics. Handles client expectations related to schedule/timeline.Presents insights and data through written and data visualization. Leads department and team level presentations on data insights.Works effectively and collaborates with other team members and across the organization.Maintains current knowledge and awareness of technical developments in the field of data analytics.Performs other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties). QualificationsRequired QualificationsBachelor's Degree in data science, data analytics, or social science or equivalent training and/or experience.3 years - Professional experience related to analytical activities.Strong analytical thinking, analysis, and problem solving skills and ability to communicate abstract ideas clearly.Knowledge of and ability to manage data acquisition from multiple sources, and analysis.Business acumen, technical knowledge and knowledge in applications (e.g., SQL, SAP) and technologies.Ability to manage multiple work streams independently.Good relationship management skills.Ability to identify and draw on analytical tools and techniques to develop creative approaches and insights to client issues.Must be able to write and present clear and efficient insights developed through the analysis.Preferred QualificationsExperience with PowerBI or other Business Intelligence tools.Knowledge of Google Analytics, YouTube Analytics, or other Marketing Analytics toolsets.Knowledge of Social Media reporting and analytics.Knowledge of census, demographics, and other customer communications data.Beginning knowledge of modeling data-based tendencies to help predict customer attributions for communications.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status.Area of InterestExternal Affairs/Marketing/Communications Full-Time/Part-TimeFull-time

title: Data Analyst II, Insights & Analytics
description: Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products and services on the planet. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to immigrants sending their hard earned money home. Today, we are incredibly proud to have served millions of customers globally with Remitly and our newly launched Passbook app to provide immigrants access to banking. We strive daily to meet our promise to our customers by building peace of mind into everything we do. Join over 1,800 employees across 9 offices who are growing their careers while having a positive impact on people globally.About The RoleThe Reconciliation Insights and Analytics team builds critical financial products and tools that ensure the accuracy and completeness of our financial data. We focus on analyzing and detecting data discrepancies, reducing losses, improving customer experience, and delivering business insight. Our data supports data consumers like Accounting, Treasury, Finance, and Customer Success.If you love driving critical thinking and insight into challenging, unstructured problems and working with leaders in the organization to bring those insights into action, this role is for you.As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for doing extensive analysis and management of reconciliation data. The quantitative insights you bring will have an out-sized impact on the business. You will work closely with program managers, other analysts, engineers, and customer and partner specialists. You will report to the Sr. Manager of Insights & Analytics.This role can be located in our Seattle, WA office or remote from anywhere in the USA.You WillApply statistical and programming skills to convert raw data into insights that enhances reporting, dashboards and metrics that drive and optimize operations and product actionsCreating and maintaining reports, ad hoc reporting, visualizations, and tools; developing key insights for almost all teams at the organization including leadershipIdentify opportunities for automation of reporting and business processes; and support associated solution design and implementation of tools & technologyYou HaveBiased for action: willing to build the first prototype, and continuously improve based on learnings.Have a bachelor's degree in a technical or quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Statistics, or related field).Experience with data visualization and related tools (e.g., Tableau, Periscope).2+ years of experience building reports and models (e.g., SQL, spreadsheet modeling, R, Python).Knowledge in ETL tools (like Amazon S3 and Redshift)Experience in analyzing large volumes of data.Enjoy working in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment with a passion for problem-solving.Possess a natural curiosity to dive into the details and have a strong analytical mindset.Our BenefitsUnlimited paid time offHealth, dental, and vision benefits + 401k plan with company matchingCompany contributions to your HSA or FSA plan, if you choose oneEmployee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) available for eligible employeesContinuing education and corridor travel benefitsRemitly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal employment opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at Remitly. We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman's potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.Remitly is an E-Verify Employer

title: Data Analyst
description: We’re building a new kind of company, and we are building it from the inside out, which means that investing in hiring, developing, and retaining the brightest minds is a top priority. Everything we do is grounded in three simple values: trust, transparency, and fairness. From our business model to our culture, we live our values to the extreme whether were dealing with employees, retail partners, or consumers. We believe that happiness is the highest level of success, and we want every person that crosses paths with PICKUP to achieve it.As a Data Analyst with PICKUP, you are a trusted member of the Business Intelligence team who specializes in presenting technical concepts to a non-technical audience. Responsibilities will include identifying and solving problems for the organization, using data analysis techniques to get practical information from raw data, building reports and visualizations based on findings, and communicating findings to stakeholders.ResponsibilitiesWork with business units to identify opportunities for improvementAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsCreate reports for internal teams and/or external clientsCollect data, create, and maintain analytics views stored in the data lakeGenerate insights via visualization tools for business units and executivesTraining end-users on new reports and dashboardsProviding technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansingIngest ad hoc requests and provide quick solutionsEducation & ExperienceBS in Data Analysis, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other related fieldMaster’s degree preferred3+ years experience as a data analyst or related fieldWorking knowledge of data warehousing and ETL techniquesReporting and data visualization skills (Looker is preferred)Experience with data lakes such as Snowflake preferredRequired Job Skills/AbilitiesExcellent ability to communicate effectively with others using spoken and written EnglishStrong SQL coding skills, Python a plusComfortable with communicating technical processes to non-technical stakeholdersStrong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving abilitiesAbility to identify and solve complex technical problemsFamiliarity with data design patterns, principles, and practicesKeen attention to detail  Company Background PICKUP® is the enterprise-grade, last-mile delivery service and one of the nation’s fastest-growing on-demand logistics providers. Our team features trust-verified PICKUP Delivery Professionals delivering big & heavy items (including assembly) - from household essentials to furniture and mattresses - in as little as one hour. PICKUP has partnered with leading retailers and commercial businesses to transform their omnichannel delivery experience with solutions such as Contactless Buy Online Deliver From Store (BODFS). Our intelligent platform and success teams enable PICKUP Delivery Professionals to consistently provide exceptional customer experiences. We currently operate in over 70 service markets with aggressive expansion plans. We are a customer-obsessed culture of creative problem-solvers. If this sounds like you, join our mission to build the best last mile in the nation.EEO StatementPICKUP is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. PICKUP is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Data Analyst
description: See yourself at Twilio.Join the team as our next Data Analyst (L3).Who We Are & Why We’re HiringTwilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we have presence throughout South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We're on a journey to becoming a globally anti-racist, anti-oppressive, anti-bias company that actively opposes racism and all forms of oppression and bias. At Twilio, we support diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum.About The JobTwilio is looking for a Data Analyst to build the future of conversational messaging as part of the Advanced Communications Platform. Working side-by-side with product managers and senior business leaders, you will provide the analysis and tools that will help define the strategy and drive execution for Advanced Communications at Twilio. The Advanced Communications Platform is building developer and consumer products to help customers scale and deploy new interactive messaging experiences worldwide. In this role, you will develop deep expertise regarding the future of rich communications on WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, Instagram, Google Business Messages/RCS, Apple Business Chat, and other new channels.ResponsibilitiesAs a Data Analyst, you will live the Twilio Magic values: WRITE IT DOWN: Determine requirements to drive the execution of new analysis projects, forecasts, and dashboards with engineering, design, and operations counterparts.  DRAW THE OWL: Design and launch robust data processing pipelines, integrations, and dashboards while simultaneously optimizing for performance and stakeholder requirements. Investigate complex product and operational issues, design experiments, and make recommendations  BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: Work directly with business leaders (directors, product managers, and engineering managers) to define and own the datasets, reports, dashboards they need to run their product organizations.  EMPOWER OTHERS: Work across Twilio teams to share knowledge, train team members, and improve internal processes.  NO SHENANIGANS: Clearly communicate results with attention to detail, accuracy, and context. QualificationsNot all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!Required 3+ years experience in a data analyst role  3+ years experience writing complex SQL statements  3+ years experience working with tools like Looker, Tableau, Hive, Presto, Kibana, etc.  Track record of making recommendations based on data analysis  Excellent communication skills  You have analyzed complex problems and have the aptitude to navigate uncharted waters  You are curious, collaborative, humble, and empathetic  Collaborative mindset and ability to work with distributed, cross-functional teams  Experience managing products at various stages of maturity, from legacy to greenfield  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Desired Technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility  Experience with statistical analysis in Python or R is a plus  Experience with AI/ML is a plus LocationThis role will be located in our San Francisco, CA office.What We OfferThere are many benefits to working at Twilio, including things like competitive pay, generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.Twilio thinks big. Do you?We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic . Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now!If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions .Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com .

title: Data Analyst -Entry Level/Junior (Remote)
description: GrahmSain is a quantitative & technology development investment boutique. We are analysts, scientists and technologists on a mission to solve the most complex financial problems through analytical rigour and exceptional technology.Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our mission to continually enhance our performance. We seek to attract great talent by offering a dynamic environment, great career opportunities and competitive compensation packages. If you are someone who enjoys stretching yourself professionally, who excited to innovate every day and explore new ideas you’ll find a way to build a gratifying career at GrahmSain.About Role And Your Key ResponsibilitiesData is at the core of our business and we drive automation and self-service solutions wherever possible. This isn’t restricted to user solutions, but also includes our own development processes, which creates capacity within the team to develop new solutions and ideas. Data Preparation – Able to apply and explain intermediate data blending techniques. Able to apply intermediate checks, implement data quality precautions and is able to use analytics techniques to prepare data for analysis. Data Modelling – Able to create basic data models/scenarios without guidance. Data Visualisation – Ability to create insightful visualisations (e.g. charts, dashboards), tell stories with data and compellingly convey insights and recommendations. Thought Partnership – Is able to interact with individual stakeholders to understand their business needs and to make suggestions for analyses and metrics to drive insights and recommendations. Understands who the customers are and what is happening in the market with necessary commercial awareness.Your Skills And Experience Advanced knowledge of excel, knowledge of Python programming and PowerBI; Knowledge of analytical best practice in performance measurement, attribution, ex-ante and ex-post risk and portfolio exposure metrics; Analytical mindset, pro-active approach and the ability to work effectively in a team; Strong time management skills and attention to detail; andWhat We Will Offer You Competitive compensation packages Health Insurance (inc. dental & vision) Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression And more flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needsAt GrahmSain we promote great working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

title: Analyst, Data Science
description: Mediahub is a global media planning and buying company with over 900 employees worldwide. We are an award-winning agency built for challenger brands – those disrupting the status quo and looking to reinvent how to reach consumers and measure success. Our smart and nimble team consists of key verticals including Insights + Action (Comms), P3 (Search, Paid Social & Programmatic), and our creative media group, the R+D (Radical + Disruptive) Lab, which specializes in working with avant-garde media partners to develop ideas that consumers seek out, share and talk about.As one of the three major Interpublic media agencies (NYSE: IPG), we are powered by the buying and intelligence power of Magna Global and the data and tech backbone of Kinesso. We’re proud to have been named Adweek’s 2018 U.S. Media Agency of the Year and Ad Age's 2019 and 2020 Media Agency of the Year.Our mission? To be an agency that attracts, retains, and promotes outstanding employees of all backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities while fostering an accepting, antiracist culture and atmosphere where all employees can do their best work and feel safe, fulfilled and appreciated. We hope you will join us!Position OverviewThe Analyst role supports AA Managers, Associate Director and Directors. An Analyst should be able to build statistical/mathematical models with guidance, and should be interested in learning new modeling techniques. A successful candidate will be someone who thrives in a dynamic, fast paced setting and to able to provide high-quality analytical skills under tight, constantly shifting deadlines.ResponsibilitiesWork efficiently with clients and internal teams to define, extract, and synthesize available data and share results and insight with Mediahub team members.Maintain and improve existing predictive models to evaluate media efficacy and effectiveness, willing to develop new models to help answer business questions.Glean actionable insights to support in-market campaign optimization.Perform statistical analysis of primary and syndicated research, media spend and allocation, and businessperformance data.Support proactive "what-if" analysis and guide marketing and advertising decision-making.Analyze scenarios to assess the before/after impacts of target market selection, media choice andallocation on client's business performance.Collaborate and partner with other agency departments -- Media, Brand Planning, PR/Social Influence,Creative, and User Experience -- in the pursuit of data-driven insights and strategies. QualificationsEducation: Master’s degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Business, Marketing Analytics, or other quantitative discipline strongly preferred.Experience: 2-4 years of work experience (plus master’s degree) in a professional services environment: management consulting, market research, advertising, statistical modeling, or interactive/technology consulting.Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Tableau.Advanced knowledge of one of these statistical software packages: SAS/R/Python.Ability to build mathematical/statistical models up to medium complexity with appropriate guidance.Ability to work with analysts in model development and application of statistical methods.Solid understanding of generalized linear regression, direct/ digital marketing test designs, and audience segmentation.Ability to translate insights from marketing activities into actionable business recommendationsAbility to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization.Attention to detail and time management to deliver high quality work for multiple projects across severalclient engagements while meeting deadlines.Strong desire to learn new modeling techniques to help answer business questions.BENEFITS OF JOINING MEDIAHUB: One of our primary goals is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our compensation plan includes the following benefits, in addition to many others: Healthcare Options Medical Dental Vision Prescription Coverage Dependent and Health Care Flexible Spending Accounts 401(k) savings plan with company match Unlimited PTO and year-round “Summer Fridays”Paid family leaveHealth and wellness support including an Employee Assistance Program, Calm/Headspace discounts, parenting resources and moreOn-demand professional coachingLegal Assistance Plan Employee Stock Purchase PlanExclusive discounts on cell phones, gyms, and everyday purchasesEmployees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and, if hired, present proof of vaccination prior to start date, unless eligible for a medical or religious accommodation or other accommodation required under applicable law.You must be eligible to work in the United States to be considered for this role.This job description is subject to change at any time.Work is regularly performed in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.ACCESSIBILITY NOTICE: If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process due to a physical or mental disability, please send an email to: disabilityaccommodations@mullenlowe.com - please include your location in the subject line of your email (BOS, NY, LA, WNS)Mediahub is an EEO/AA M/F/Disability/Vet Employer.Mediahub participates in E-Verify.https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdfhttps://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.p

title: Data Analyst
description: The primary function of the Data Analyst role is to provide data reshaping, data mining and visualization services at TSIA. The Data Analyst will work with the data analytics team to provide insights to a variety of internal and external stakeholders. Over time, the Data Analyst will become a leading expert in both the data TSIA aggregates on the Technology Services industry and the operational data within the organization.The new hire will gain and mature desirable analytic skills while working in a small cross-functional team of analysts, engineers, and project managers. The “aTeam” leverages an efficient tool stack to manage TSIA data streams in the Research department, as well as in Sales, Marketing, Member Success, and Product Development. The new hire will become proficient at deriving insight from raw data that lives anywhere; and embedding those insights into data driven processes of colleagues and customers.Primary ResponsibilitiesProvide Data Insight for Cross-Departmental Projects and Processes· Reshape data from a variety of sources to achieve to business insights· Embed reshaped data into existing and new workflows· Build and optimize dashboards to optimize insightRoom for GrowthThe Data Analyst will have several growth paths at TSIA depending on individual interests and passions, including, but not limited to:· Increased ownership of projects and mentorship, with a path to Lead of Data Analytics· Data mining and statistical analysis, with a path to Data Scientist· Specialization in Visualization and Dashboards Qualifications· 1 to 2 years of professional experience with data reshaping and analysis· Bachelors’ degree in a technical field with significant data analysis· Proficient with SQL, SOQL, and other query languages· Experience with easy to use ETL tools such as Alteryx, Knime, or RapidMiner· Experience with easy to use visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Microsoft Power BI; experience with integrating these tools via APIs into websites a plus· Good verbal communication and written skills· Advanced computer skills, including MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).· Must be a strong team player, motivated by both individual and team achievementReporting· Director of Data Analytics, TSIACompensation· Upon requestKey MetricsLike every employee at TSIA, this position will be evaluated on the ability of the association to grow and meet the business needs of members. Additionally, this position will be evaluated on the following metrics:· Quality of Data Reshaping processes and documentation· Quality of visualization – insightful, intuitive.· Process innovation.· Peer evaluation.Location: Remote. Option to work from San Diego office at our company headquarters or in Los Gatos at our secondary office.Send your cover letter and resume for consideration.About TSIAThere are many reasons why we think you’ll love being part of the TSIA team (like flexible hybrid or remote work options, a great benefits package, professional development opportunities, and unlimited paid time off, to name a few), but here are three we think you’ll be really excited about:We’re a growth company. Since TSIA was founded in 2009, we’ve steadily grown year over year, and we continue to see growth as we expand into new markets and add new offerings to our product portfolio. As a privately-owned company, we maintain the advantage of being able to be nimble and dynamic, which empowers employees to make quick decisions, learn from mistakes, and work together as one TSIA team to accomplish our goals.We work with the biggest and best names in tech. TSIA is the world’s leading research organization dedicated to helping technology companies of all sizes achieve profitable growth and solve their top business challenges. That means when you join the TSIA team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with tech companies from around the globe and interact with some of the top executives in the industry. And with 80% of the Fortune 100 Tech companies as our members, we have a strong foothold in the industry and are making a big impact.We value our employees and promote from within. At TSIA, we know that the secret to providing the best experience for our members starts with happy employees. Our company culture celebrates diversity, individuality, and growth, providing you with ample opportunities to showcase your strengths with support for further developing your skills. We understand the importance of a healthy work-life balance, and pride ourselves in creating an ideal environment for you to advance your career — come grow with us! To find your role at TSIA, go to www.tsia.com/careers.

title: Data Analyst

They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analyses for business users.ResponsibilitiesUnderstand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with dataCompile and analyze data related to business issuesDevelop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashionQualificationsBachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experienceProficient in SQL

title: Data Analyst
description: Kroger is on a mission to build the best instore and online grocery shopping experience, competing against the best in e-commerce. Our goal is to connect customers with the most comprehensive assortment of quality products in the most convenient ways. As part of this mission, we want to build a robust fulfillment service to assist our employees working at stores and distribution centers, satisfy customer orders in an accurate and timely manner, irrelevant of the ordering channel and delivery mechanisms. This includes innovations and efficiencies leveraging technologies such as robotics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, voice assist etc. Efficiencies and accuracy in fulfilling orders will allow Kroger to offer its customers competitive pricing and a great customer experience.  As a Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to understand and turn into useful information the data that can be used for critical decision-making within the Kroger Fulfillment domain. You will build and own the Kroger Fulfillment Services’ insights and will help identify strengths and opportunities within the domain. Responsibilities include the deep analysis of the Fulfillment data and then determining the best way to represent it visually to managers and stakeholders. Data quality assurance, process documentation and definition of KPIs within the Fulfillment domain will also be your responsibilities.You will strive to continuously improve the data insights delivery processes & practices and be a role model to other analyst from the teams.  You will join an innovative, distributed Software Delivery team within the US's largest grocery retailer with a scale that reaches millions of people every day. Our teams are truly agile and empowered to own all aspects of their domain comprehensively. We encourage a culture of quality software practices and respect for the human spirit. We are committed to being an inclusive and transparent culture, cultivating the best engineers and analysts, allowing them to define our Kroger Technology platforms' future. If this inspires you, apply and talk to our team!    ROLE DESCRIPTION · Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction. · Work with engineers, product owners, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.· Prepare reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.· Author and publish data governance models, data lineage and data dictionary for Fulfillment Services data catalog. · Assign numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.· Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends. · Focus on overall product’s data quality and user experience.· Build standards, processes, and procedures to deliver best results.· Assist the Scrum Master in creating technical stories/spikes, backlog refinement and sprint planning. · Adapt quickly to changing technology and business requirements. · Stay up to date on emerging technologies across Kroger and the industry.   REQUIREMENTS · Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.· Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data. · Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, R, MATLAB, and Python.· Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation. · Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)· Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)· Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik · Adept at queries, authoring reports, and making presentations.· Familiarity with standard IT security practices such as identity and access management, SSO, data protection, encryption, certificate, and key management. · Excellent written and verbal communication skills. · Self-starter takes the initiative and works well under pressure. · Business-minded approach to time, costs, and milestones.· Can work well within a matrixed team environment.   MINIMUM QUALIFICATION/EDUCATION · 5-7+ years of IT experience · 2+ years of experience as a data analyst or in a related field· Bachelor's degree strongly preferred   BONUS POINTS · Experience with working in public cloud environments: Azure, AWS, GCP· Experience with Azure Service Fabric, Azure Databricks, AI/ML · Experience with NoSQL, BigData· Experience in Retail industry· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment a big plus

title: Data Analyst - Telecommute
description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)This is an exciting role in the growing OptumCare division within UnitedHealth Group. Our ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about working with data and driven to deliver creative and compelling solutions which turn data into actionable information for our business. The role will be responsible for analyzing, designing and developing innovative data visualization solutions which drive business insights. Tableau is our preferred platform but just as important is a solid foundation in data visualization best practices and techniques. This role will partner with developers, other business analysts and reporting/data customers to understand data needs. This role will partner heavily with our IT partners to implement data structures needed to support analytics/reporting/client data needs.You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the team to communicate business and data requirements and iteratively design visualizations for initial concepts and prototypes that can be presented to customers for feedback Perform detailed data analysis and testing (i.e. determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples) Troubleshoot data quality and logic/mapping issues affecting visualizations to determine root causeDefine, execute, analyze, interpret and approve complex/nested SQL queries Collaborate with data governance to define standards and best practices for managing dashboards and related technologies (e.g. versioning, run books, quality controls)Partner to establish best practices for data structures to support reporting and analyticsSupport activities to document, evolve, and communicate artifacts developed using Tableau and the reporting databaseProvide technical assistance and cross training to other team membersPartner with technical team to resolve report and data issues submitted by business partnersYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required Qualifications3+ years of experience in business / finance including analysis experience with a solid understanding of data storage structures3+ years of experience in analysis of business processes and workflows, and providing evaluations, benchmarks, and/or process improvement recommendationsIntermediate level experience in SQL and ExcelBusiness analysis experienceSolid understanding of data interpretation, best practices and techniquesPreferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration or related field3+ years of experience in translating business requirements into technical requirements3+ years with data warehouses/marts supporting BI and reporting needsExperience writing free-hand SQL queriesHealthcare domain knowledge, particularly with clinical data structures Experience with data governance processesFamiliarity with Salesforce.com data sourcesExperience with TableauStrong communication and collaboration skills when working with stakeholders to drive changeTo protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employmentCareers at OptumCare. We're on a mission to change the face of health care. As the largest health and wellness business in the US, we help 58 million people navigate the health care system, finance their health care needs and achieve their health and well-being goals. Fortunately, we have a team of the best and brightest minds on the planet to make it happen. Together we're creating the most innovative ideas and comprehensive strategies to help heal the health care system and create a brighter future for us all. Join us and learn why there is no better place to do your life's best work.(sm)OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians.All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $66,100 to $118,300. The salary range for Connecticut/Nevada residents is $72,800 to $129,900. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment

title: Data Analyst
description: R331218Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Job SummaryResponsible for defining business intelligence requirements for individual subject areas; develops conceptual data models, design, build and test sets of reporting and analytic business intelligence programs. Works cross-functionally to collect data and makes actionable recommendations at all levels. Infers trends from a variety of data sources and confidently delivers their interpretation; makes recommendations to executives. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.Job DescriptionCore ResponsibilitiesPlans and executes multiple projects involving all aspects of business intelligence solutions and data, including business intelligence analysis and data exploitation.Takes business intelligence to the next level to support business decisions and recommend best practices and policy in business intelligence implementation, maintenance and data quality.Contributes to a variety of projects related to development, testing and implementation of new and modified business intelligence systems in an efficient and cost-effective manner.Leads analysis and recommendations relating to organization's optimization and testing efforts.Customizes business intelligence report contents and views using Excel, Access and other tools to meet the requirements of internal business customers.Works with team and customers to define business requirements, resolve technical issues and provide training.Works cross-functionally to implement key projects. Interfaces with other departments to leverage data for their respective business needs.Tracks web site usage using Omniture and other web tracking tools.Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Employees at all levels are expected to:Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.Drive results and growth.Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.EducationBachelor's DegreeWhile possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.Relevant Work Experience2-5 YearsBase pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Company Overview: For over 30 years, Cerulli has provided global asset and wealth management firms with unmatched, actionable insights. Headquartered in Boston with fully staffed offices in London and Singapore, Cerulli Associates is a global research and consulting firm that provides financial institutions with guidance in strategic positioning and new business development. Our analysts blend industry knowledge, original research, and data analysis to bring perspective to current market conditions and forecasts for future developments. designs, or data showcases  Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science or related field0-2 years of experienceWork experience as a data analyst or in title: Data Analyst
description: Must Haves: -Experience in a Data Analysis or Data Engineering -Proven ability to use Data & Analytics to drive business decisions -Demonstrated experience with SQL, Python, R, Tableau and similar language tools-Proficiency in MS office suite.-Excellent written and verbal communication -Bachelor’s degree minimum requirement for conversion Plusses: -Salesforce CRM post implementation mapping  Day to day: The Sales Operations Business Partner will play a key role in launching new salesforce.com platform, be responsible for managing all aspects of the Commercial Analytics inbox, be the main point of contact for the field and field leadership for questions, responsible for updating and maintaining field sales Tableau dashboards, and maintaining territory alignment tables. The primary role of this function is to support the field sales team and provide different ways to drive the business to its revenue targets. RESPONSIBILITIESThe Business Partner will play a lead role in discovering and providing data insights, analytical support, business understanding, and a strategic perspective in improving the decision-making process within the commercial organizations. Working in a matrix environment with other shared services functions (IT, HR, Finance, Commercial Excellence, etc.), this position serves as the business unit partner working closely with internal and external leaders throughout the organization. The primary function for this position is to provide business intelligence and data analysis support, execute sophisticated quantitative analysis, and develop advanced modeling that translates data into actionable insights for our team. This person must be very detailed orientated, accurate, skilled in SQL, Python, R, or Tableau, accountable for own work and able to multi-task. Evaluate and communicate key trends for sales and marketing.Go to analyst for Customer Success, Customer Solutions, Contracts, Sales Enablement, and Corporate Accounts.Design and develop sales reporting tools for field.Prepare, validate, and distribute ad hoc reports and analysis as requested by management.Provide quantitative recommendations to management team for evaluation.Collaborate with various departments on robust solution for companies growing needs. Develop and identify key motivational drivers and strategic business management tools to increase productivity and sales effectiveness.Successfully partner and support field sales personnel.Work and communicate with senior management trends, ideas, and opportunities that will enhance revenue and decrease corporate expenses.Ensure that all projects are completed in a timely manner and within budget, performing any additional duties as required/assigned by supervisor.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data AnalystLocation: Remote - USWHY YOU’LL LOVE SALESLOFT:Put Customers First. Team Over Self. Focus on Results. Bias Towards Action. Glass Half Full.These are the values that define who we are and have empowered our staggering growth to become the #1 leader in sales engagement software.Salesloft helps brands deliver value and create trust by connecting authentically and meaningfully with their customers. Thousands of customers depend on Salesloft’s category-leading sales engagement platform to engage in more relevant, authentic and sincere ways.Since our founding in 2011, we have grown into a global, award-winning organization with Lofters based all over the world. As a testament to our organizational health, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Startup Employers in 2020, twice by Deloitte as a ‘Fastest-Growing Technology Company in North America,’ and have been recognized as a top workplace by Forbes, Fortune, Glassdoor, Atlanta Journal Constitution, and Inc Magazine.We’re redefining an age-old industry! This is challenging work – but our team of brilliant creatives makes the journey thrilling. We’re fast-paced, innovative, and collaborative. We pursue excellence in everything and have a lot of fun along the way. Come join us!Check us out on Glassdoor and see what people LOVE about working for Salesloft!The OpportunityAlthough we're proud of our history, we're just as excited about the future. We want to create a world-class culture and company that attracts, develops, engages and retains the nation's elite talent.At SalesLoft, our Data Analysts are pivotal to our company's success. You will be a key member of our fast-growing and high-performing Data & Analytics team responsible for helping departments monitor their performance, understand trends, and make more informed decisions.In addition to working with amazing colleagues who exemplify our 'team over self' core value, you will also have the opportunity to champion data driven decisions to inform product strategy. You will have an opportunity to make a difference.What We’re Looking For:We are seeking an experienced, results-oriented Data Analyst who can enable the business to make better decisions with data. We are interested in people who are equal parts analytically focused and business driven, motivated by solving real world problems and exploring new approaches.On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for delivering actionable insights that drive positive change across the business. You will leverage complex datasets to identify and quantify key performance indicators. You will create dashboards and data visualizations that monitor & measure success. You will develop best practices & training materials for data-savvy users within functional departments. title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: EF Ultimate Break inspires young adults to participate in life-changing travel experiences across the globe. EF Ultimate Break is a division of EF Education First and is the easiest way to travel abroad for anyone 18-29 years old. Every trip gives travelers the chance to make friends, explore new places, and immerse themselves in different cultures – on fun, affordable, life-changing adventures.This position is part of both Ultimate Break’s Marketing and Data Analytics teams and will be responsible for actioning our collected marketing data to help the business measure, understand, and predict user behavior and market trends.You should be an energetic, curious, and collaborative person who is interested in proactively driving results through data and is excited about working in a fast-paced e-commerce environment. This role will leverage data across a variety of internal and external sources to evaluate our marketing performance and generate actionable insights and recommendations. You will also assist in ad-hoc marketing analysis requests including understanding site visitor behavior, identifying ‘customer pain points’ and measuring the impact of promotions and merchandising decisions.The ideal candidate must have a solid analytics background, be able to deliver actionable insights with high accuracy and have a strong sense of urgency. Interested?See more about the role and how to apply here: https://careers.ef.com/job/?jobid=24058

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data AnalystLocation: Remote - US  WHY YOU’LL LOVE SALESLOFT:Put Customers First. Team Over Self. Focus on Results. Bias Towards Action. Thousands of customers depend on Salesloft’s category-leading sales engagement platform to engage in more relevant, authentic and sincere ways.Since our founding in 2011, we have grown into a global, award-winning organization with Lofters based all over the world. As a testament to our organizational health, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Startup Employers in 2020, twice by Deloitte as a ‘Fastest-Growing Technology Company in North America,’ and have been recognized as a top workplace by Forbes, Fortune, Glassdoor, Atlanta Journal Constitution, and Inc Magazine.We’re redefining an age-old industry! title: Junior Data Analyst
description: The Atlanta Journal-Constitution is investing heavily in the Applied Analytics team and is looking to fill a critical role that will provide audience insights to the Company to support critical business decisions and help guide strategy. The Jr. Data Analyst will work the Applied Analytics team and stakeholders to build reusable data solutions that support stakeholders metrics and reporting needs.This position will also create new reports using Power BI, present and communicate insights to stakeholders, become familiar with big data environments, and take on ad hoc projects as needed.Job Duties And Job TasksThe Jr. Data Analyst position will help influence decisions by supporting and helping to inspire a data-driven analytics culture with the Applied Analytics team. This position will require the ability to work both independently and within a team on analytical projects, and the undertaking of analysis activities to deliver insights in accordance with stakeholder needs and conforming to agreed standard, as well as understanding and using appropriate methods, tools, and applications to demonstrate a logical and organized approach to work.Primary Responsibilities Develops an understanding for the data warehouse structure, writes and maintains complex SQL queries, and works with stakeholders to gather data and requirements for reporting. 25% Supports and understands data from various departments and databases to build reusable data solutions that support different departments needs. 20% Designs and develops Power BI reporting, maintains a clean reporting environment, and ensures data accuracy, data security, report access and distribution. 25% Presents insights and recommendations to partners and stakeholders, ensures accuracy of results produced as a result of data analysis, and maintains communication with stakeholders and upkeep of business-critical insights. 20% Takes on ad hoc projects from different departments and supports team with business-critical projects as needed. 10% Education  Bachelors degree in a relevant field (Data Sciences, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Computer Science, etc.)Experience Graduates with internships preferred as would be 1 or more years of experience.Additional Requirements Experience in multiple coding languages and platforms (SQL, Python, R, DAX, etc.) Proven conceptual understanding of relational data stores, big data environments, transactional systems, and process flows Excellent communication skills required. Ability to successfully comprehend and communicate advanced analytics, business insights, and resulting implications to non-technical business partners. Experience using cloud computing to build analytics applications. AWS experience a plus. Be a self-sufficient, self-starter, having worked effectively on your own or within a small teamAbout CoxCox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses – which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications – is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today!Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page.Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. description: Lockheed Martin Aeronautics.
