title: Data Quality Analyst
description: About YohanaAt Yohana, we’re finding new ways for technology and design to lighten our loads, reclaim our time,and improve our well-being. We want it all. A career and home. Family and friends. Health andwellness. But actually having it all can leave us feeling overloaded. And research shows it. 43% ofpeople struggle with decision-making. 66% say overload affects their work, and 62%, theirinterpersonal relationships.Technology was supposed to help by making us more efficient. But the faster we get things done, themore we take on, and our well-being falls to the bottom of the list. Yohana is on a mission to makebalance a priority – and do it joyfully.It’s a meaningful product challenge: helping society reclaim time and make space for joy throughtechnology and design. That’s what the team at Yohana is solving for every day, and we have a lot offun doing it. With leadership from big tech like Google, Apple, Microsoft, and hypergrowth startupslike Nest, Waymo, TaskRabbit, and Casper, we’re motivated to make the world a happier place. Joinus!About The RoleWe are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join Yohana’s growing Data and Algorithms team. Reporting to the VP of Data & Algorithms this person will help the company by maturing our data platform from a quality and consistency perspective, while also driving data centric insights. We are looking for someone who can build ETL and automated data-centric testing systems to tame complex and noisy data.What You’ll Get To DoDefine and manage data: cleaning, mapping, mastering, deduping, and QAAssemble and munge data sets across multiple sources and systemsIdentify and update systems and reports due to changes in data or requirementsPresent solutions and findings to stakeholders at all levels within the company Create analytical answers and solutions to stakeholder questionsCreate and update internal system documentation What You’ll Bring:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, STEM field, or similar experience (MBA or Masters/PhD. preferred)3+ years of experience building out Data Quality and Analytic systems and solutions (5+ years of experience preferred)Experience building and maintaining systems for data quality, master data management, and ETL consistencyExperience in creating well thought out data models and MDM systemsExperience using SQL to collect and manage dataAbility to discuss projects and solutions with all members of the companyExperience in defining and building out: KPIs, Analytics, Reporting, Dashboards preferredExperience working within Tableau, Salesforce, Google Analytics, or other modern Analytic platforms preferredPrior experience working with big data and associated systems preferred What We Offer:Opportunity to join a hyper-growth startup on a mission to make well-being attainable for modern familiesCompetitive compensationComprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, FSA)401(k) with employer matchLife & Short Term Disability InsuranceSupplemental Medical CoverageUnlimited PTO12 Company HolidaysPaid Maternity & Parental LeavePaid Caregiver LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgramGroup and 1-on-1 Career CoachingPet InsuranceCasual Dress CodeCatered Lunch & SnacksDiscounts on Panasonic productsCompany Social EventsWe are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest.

title: Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics)
description: You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.Position PurposeInterpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadershipIdentify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customersManage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelinesSupport the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automationApply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic productsSupport multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partnersIndependently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate resultsCommunicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when requiredOur Comprehensive Benefits PackageFlexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibilityCompetitive payPaid Time Off including paid holidaysHealth insurance coverage for you and dependents401(k) and stock purchase plansTuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.Education/ExperienceBachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/query languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionWhere you will work: USA (remote)About The RoleOur Retention Team is looking for a Sr. Retention Analyst to support our Unified Communications and Collaboration (UCC) products. The ideal candidate will have experience in extracting insights from relational databases and conveying them to a business audience. In this role, you will use your experience with data and statistics to drive customer retention through various analytical techniques and by partnering with our data science team to leverage predictive models. Excellent communication skills are also required, as this is a highly visible and influential role that will collaborate with cross-functional teams and present information to business leaders.Your Day to DayAs a Sr. Retention Analyst, you would be working on:Assist with test planning and development from idea stage through results analysis, partnering on how to iterate and improve.Partner with adoption marketing to help prioritize focus areas based on value and opportunity to improve future retention.Work closely with the adoption team, proactively identify opportunities aligned with our shared goal of reducing churn through improved activation and increased engagement.Partner with data science and retention teams to create customer segmentation strategy based on current customer insightsLeverage data-driven customer segments, develop and test targeted customer marketing programs to drive improved retention outcomes.Implement reporting and tracking for key customer cohorts identified in the customer segmentation strategyProvide deeper insights by segment and identify key drivers of health and retention for each customer cohortAnalyze impact of marketing programs on lagging customer outcomes (such as adoption and retention) to identify key levers that are having an impactBe the go-to source for customer insights on retention and product adoption for the UCC Marketing Team and CX Retention Leads.Partner with other data teams in Care and Product to develop deep understanding of customer base from multiple angles and perspectives.What We Are Looking ForAs a Senior Retention Analyst your background will look like:Required Soft Skills / Experience:3-5 Years of experience in an analytical roleBachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or related quantitative disciplineStrong communication/interaction skills – proven track-record of impacting business performance with analyticsSelf-motivated individual who strives to continue to self-guided development for their technical skillsetRequired Technical Skills:Advanced SQL Skills (Presto, Hive, Snowflake)Experience using Python, R, SAS or similar for analyzing and using statistical methodsExperience with BI Tools (Tableau Preferred, Looker, Power BI)Experience working with Salesforce.comExperience designing and measuring a/b testsAdvanced proficiency with ExcelYou’ll be working towards a shared goal with an open-minded and cohesive team greater than the sum of its parts. At GoTo, we’re passionate about growing a diverse and inclusive work ecosystem because unique takes make us a stronger company, and Stronger Together. We’re committed to creating an inclusive space for everyone, no matter what. That’s how we’ll Be Real, Think Big, Move Fast, and Keep Growing along the way.

title: Data Analyst
description: NEED TO BE ADVANCED WITH EXCEL. POSITION IS PAYING $22-24 A HOUR TO START DEPENDING ON EXPERIENCE*Supports improvements in Quality, Cost, Delivery, Safety and People key performance indicators.Collects and monitors data and reportingConduct/facilitate process improvement projects and ongoing facility gap assessments around continuous improvement effortsSupports line startups centerlines and change overs that drive continuous improvement.Maintains all appropriate centerline documentation including process and training documentation as well as project charters, progress updates and final reportsApplies necessary technical skills to deliver improvement resultsEngages line/process/department personnel in all phases of improvement work.Supports the local management team in upstream smart solutions and best practice replication.Coordinates and/or executes specific Centerline skill training for operatorsWorks closely with the CI Leader to lead a team culture in the facility.Be the deployment champion for Del Rey problem solving methods and techniquesSet goals and objectives, both personal and as a team member, to acquire the plant goalsIdentify trends and process variation in conjunction with the Operations TeamAbout Aston Carter:At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. title: Data Analyst - 99% Remote
description: Data Analyst99% Remote with occasional days onsite in ChicagoSummaryThis person will be working on a team of data engineers, BI Developers and other data enthusiasts, assisting with a variety of functions as it relates to the end goal of powering data driven decisions for the business. This includes structuring data, working heavily with SQL, moving data, building data pipelines, working with data quality and if there's time developing dashboards and reports yourself (although we have plenty of strong folks on the team that can do this as well). We also are looking for someone who enjoys interacting with the business and other teams to understand requirements and can provide solutions based on the goals of the business.ResponsibilitiesSynthesize and interpret data into a narrative of business performance and actionable insights in deliverables of various formats. Just the data.Design, build, prototype, and deploy data analysis frameworksTranslate business needs into technical specificationsConduct and support whiteboarding sessions, workshops, design sessions, and project meetings as neededResearches and develops new algorithms and statistical techniques based on customer needsWork in partnership with business analysts, application architect, application developers to build data transactions and warehousing systemsStructure large data sets to find usable informationWork with a team of analysts and other associates to process informationWork with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvementMake effective and decisive decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project Requirements:  2+ years of experience with Data Analysis Strong SQL experienceTable structures, stored procedures, functions, views, select/insert/update Data mining, data transformation, data cleansing Ideally Azure SQL experience as well Experience working with business users and other IT team members to gather requirements regarding data projects, and documenting these requirements  Nice to have experience Azure experience (the more Azure data services you've worked with the better) Experience building data pipelines – any Python or Spark experience to help move data would be great Experience with BI or Reporting – we use Power BI so any of this experience would be great

title: Data Analyst
description: Company DescriptionEveryone wins if government works better. We provide innovative solutions and services to complex problems and processes. We apply our creative skill set and expertise to empower government. Our proficient staff is at the front line of digital media, financial services, business management, and solution development.Job DescriptionInfina is looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.Duties & Responsibilities Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsDevelop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data qualityAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsFilter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problemsWork closely with management to prioritize business and information needsLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesQualificationsBachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics; advanced degree preferredAt least five (5) years of professional work experience with data analytics Proficiency with data visualization tools; Tableau, Python, R, Looker Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks) Skilled in using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.) Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Use of analytic techniques such as classification, regression, similarity matching, clustering, co-occurrence grouping, profiling, link prediction, data reduction, and causal modelling, as well as experience developing and deploying automated processes Ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearanceAdditional InformationInfina, Ltd. is an equal employment opportunity company. All individuals are encouraged to apply.

title: Jr. Data Analyst
description: Job Description Title: Jr. Data Analyst Location: New York, NY (Midtown) Duration: 12+ months contract Pay: $600.00 - $700.00/per dayOur direct client is a leading global asset management firm. They are looking to hire a Junior Data Analyst to join their team. The candidate will take responsibility for business requirements, data analysis, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role, he or she need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.Required Skills Develop reports and analysis.  Analyzes, designs, redesigns, and documents "as is and "to be business processes.  Translates business strategies and objectives into business requirements.  Provides traceability of business requirements to IT Solutions  Analyzing confidential data and information according to guidelines.  Identifies data elements and provides data mappings/dictionaries.  Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.  Conducts/facilitates acceptance tests for solutions with user community, including, development of UAT test scenario and test scripts.  Generating reports from single or multiple systems.  Troubleshooting the business application, database and reports.  Partners with Business/IT in define and management of scope with each release.  Training end-users on new application/feature, reports, and dashboards.  High-level understanding of various API data.  High-level written and verbal communication skills.   Bonus/Soft Skills: Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.  Work experience as a data analyst or business analyst or in a related field.  Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.  Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.  Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, Client terms.  High-level experience in different project methodologies (including Waterfall and Agile)  Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.  Be a part of the ConsultNet difference. As a leading national provider of IT staffing and solutions, ConsultNet delivers exceptional services to startup, midmarket and Fortune 1000 companies across North America. Since 1996, we've partnered with clients to create rewarding opportunities for our consultants, successfully building teams that have surefire results.In the past two years alone, we have placed more than 1,500 consultants in contract, contract-to-hire, or direct placement opportunities. We understand communication is key to finding the right job that matches your skills and career goals. For us, it's not just the work that we do; it's how we do the work. Our breadth of offerings extends to multiple IT positions in major markets throughout the country, see more at - www.consultnet.com

title: Data Analyst
description: MUST BE IN CENTRAL TEXAS TO APPLY!100% remote. May need to travel to client up to once a month. Experience in banking, finance, or investment banking preferred. As a leader in our clients business you’ll help us build and evolve our advice experiences, capabilities, and product line-up to serve the needs of individual investors and independent financial advisors. You’ll help us tap into unmet investor needs and disrupt the traditionally high-cost advice marketplace using quantitative insights to uncover areas of opportunity and drive strategies that enhance the client experience. You will play a critical role in implementing the use of advanced analytics into business processes to drive strategic decision making and deepen understanding of our investors.We are looking for passionate crew who want to leverage the power of analytics to drive strategic enhancements to the client experience. As a lead analyst supporting cross-functional teams, you will use quantitative methods to inform strategy, uncover areas of opportunity, and enhance the client experience. You will perform descriptive and predictive analyses, design and measure experiments with statistical rigor, and visualize data to deliver actionable insights. You will deliver strategic insights and influence business and technology leaders using consultative skills and storytelling with data.Key Responsibilities:• Be an analytics thought leader and be the catalyst for change• Perform analyses of historical data to drive business strategy using advanced analytical methods• Visualize and tell compelling stories with data. Prepare and deliver visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement• Communicate effectively and show flexibility in style with different audiences. Explain higher level statistical methods and analytical results to a diverse audience• Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality and accuracy• Collaborate with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Bring structure to business requests, translate requirements into an analytical approach, and lead project through completion• Mentors, coaches, trains, and develops junior analysts. Proactively expands knowledge of business and analytics and shares with team members. Develops and documents best practices• Work in an ambiguous environment and adapt quickly to changeRequirements:• Undergraduate degree in an analytic/quantitative field such as: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. A graduate level degree in an analytics focused field is strongly preferred• Minimum of ten years related work experience• Expert level skills in the following suite of data analysis tools: Data Extraction languages such as SQL. Proficiency with relational databases or Big Data platforms, Data Analysis packages (Python, R, SAS etc.) and Data Visualization packages (Tableau, etc.)• Extraordinary analytical skills, coupled with the ability to form hypotheses and draw meaningful insights from disparate data sources. The ability to understand data, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate insights to audiences of various backgrounds, including senior management• Significant experience with advanced statistical and machine-learning methods such as: regression models, propensity models, segmentation, optimization, experimental test design, time series analysis, cohort analysis, Bayesian methods, decision trees, text analysis, etcCompensation & Benefits:• Competitive compensation• Leading edge global work environment• Relocation assistance• Complete benefits package• Professional development assistance

title: Data Analyst
description: We are a Chicago-based technology startup that is leading a new way forward for prescription care. We're rethinking the pharmaceutical supply chain, introducing AI-driven marketplaces that drive down costs, and new consumer tools that guide decisions on care. Led by a team of industry experts, we're fixing the high costs and broken experiences that define our pharmaceutical supply chain. We believe that better pricing, more information, and smarter tools can lower costs, empower consumers and help payers take control of their pharmacy benefits. The technology we're building is the start of a new way of working together – making better outcomes possible for all.Waltz Health ValuesIntegrity: We are committed to protecting the value of clinical care across the pharmaceutical system. We are truthful and honest in our commitments with all our partners.Inclusion: We advocate for change that benefits us all, a smarter system that works together. We embrace our differences as well as the unique perspectives our employees and partners bring with them.Access: We are focused on breaking down barriers to bring choice back to the healthcare experience. We want to help all our partners get the right prescription care at the right cost.Accountability: We take ownership for the quality of our work and the outcomes we deliver. Our focus in on delivering a best-in-class experience for our partners while achieving bold targets.Progress: We believe in moving healthcare forward in everything we do. We strive for a culture that is innovating better ways to deliver pharmaceutical care.Job DescriptionThe mission of the Data Analyst at Waltz Health is to use leading data analytics tools to identify and demonstrate value creation opportunities for consumers and clients looking to save on prescriptions. You'll do this by developing robust reporting packages for internal teams and external clients. You will work with the Waltz team to create a list of requirements, select the right technology stack, and execute to create a full reporting package from start to finish. This reporting structure will create foundation for our future growth, and establish a standard across the whole company.The Data Analyst will work with variety of tech systems spanning across the whole organization (Microsoft DevOps, Amazon S3/Redshift, Atlassian, Tableau, PostrgeSQL and etc.)As a data analyst, your activities will be centered around intake of files (Microsoft Pipeline/Python), manipulation of files (SQL/Python), visualization (Tableau, Python, Excel) and presentation internally or externally (Tableau, PowerPoint, Excel) + any additional ad-hoc analysis through Tableau/Excel. Metrics guiding your output will include: on-time delivery, accuracy, client satisfaction, and value opportunities identified.You will:Create processes around intake of raw files; dealing with storage, processing, cleaning and manipulating data through different tools (ETL)Work with internal and external teams to understand project requirements, and propose analytical solutionsDevelop and present your findings to the rest of the colleagues, using visual tools such as Excel, PowerPoint, TableauProvide data support for ad hoc projects covering our whole organization (IT, operations, finance and supply chain)You will be successful because you:Are enthusiastic, positive, and hardworking.Are flexible with job roles and responsibilities – i.e. be willing to jump into new projects and have a scrappy start-up mentality.Are a clear communicator who is comfortable working with all levels of the organization.Thrive working independently, autonomously, and can adapt to changing needs of a growing company.Are able to think effectively, critically and creatively.Have 2+ years of previous experience in data analytics work, ideally for technology and/or healthcare companies.Worked and manipulated large datasets using SQL or other languages.Created dashboards using visual tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or QlikView.Have strong communication skills in combination with experience in creating external facing PowerPoint decks.It would be preferable if you:Lived in Chicago.Have experience with Python or other programming languages.Have used product development stacks like Atlassian (i.e. Jira/Confluence) or Microsoft DevOpsHave familiarity with Postegre SQL, either directly or through other solutions such as Amazon Redshift.In the first 90 days, you will:Develop external client reporting, and set up key structure and processes that will allow us to apply it to future more complex clientsWork with product team to create KPIs, and track how we are doing on a regular basis.Meet and collaborate with our external teams to improve our current data flow and work with them on future expansions.Provide feedback on current internal reporting infrastructure, and work with internal and external team to improve existing processes.You have these qualifications:Bachelor's degreeBenefitsGround floor opportunity with one of the fastest-growing startups in health-tech.Competitive compensation including meaningful stock options. Flexible vacation and a work culture that allows for taking time to recharge.Medical, dental, vision, 401K, generous parental leave, and much more.

title: Quantitative Data Analyst
description: If you are looking for the next step, invest your mind in Intex. Join our team in providing banks, insurance firms and other large financial institutions with innovative software to structure and analyze structured-finance securities. This is a fast-paced and challenging environment, where you'll work with some of the brightest people around.Responsibilities:Retrieve, extract, and process monthly reporting data for thousands of transactions, using proprietary software toolsEnhance data processing procedures and quality assuranceProvide extensive client support for data used within Intex's core productsQualifications include:Strong work ethic and attention to detailExceptional quantitative and problem-solving skillsDemonstrated programming aptitudeInterest in improving existing systems to make them more efficientMotivated self-starter with ability to work independently and as part of a teamAbility to communicate proactively and openly with coworkers, data providers, and external clientsQuantitative Degree (e.g. Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering)1+ years' experience in a quantitative or data-oriented positionAbout Us:Intex Solutions, Inc. is the world's leading provider of structured fixed income cashflow models and related analytical software. Our clients include hundreds of the world's best known financial institutions including most major investment banks, regional broker dealers, issuers and investment managers. Intex was founded in 1985, and remains an independent, privately held company with headquarters near Boston, Massachusetts. Intex also supports its many international clients with staff and representatives in London, Tokyo and Shanghai. More information is available at our website www.intex.comLooking for applicants with at least 2+ year’s experience in a quantitative position but a senior analyst is certainly welcome.

title: Jr. Data Analyst | On-site
description: TITLE: Jr. Data Analyst | On-siteCLIENT: Energy Oil & Gas CompanyLOCATION: Houston, Texas (Energy Corridor)TYPE: Contract (6-month contract)RATE: $40-45 /hour DOESummary Must be versed in Tableau where the candidate will be providing user support and maintenance on existing dashboards. Will be testing dashboards and other tools in Tableau for the Financial Planning & Analysis group. Responsible for performing data quality checks and ensure high quality of dashboards and other data requests. Establish Data Quality metrics. Manual testing of Dashboards and user experience. Testing upgraded software and making performance recommendations and updates when needed.Requirements Worker will be asked to come to the Houston HQ site to perform duties around 40 hours per week. At least 3 years of Tableau experience, preferably in the Oil & Gas industry Experience with Data Quality: data profiling, data cleansing, scrubbing data and translating via business rulesEducation BA/BS degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration, or similar field

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description:Phreesia is looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about healthcare and solving complex problems with data to join our Life Sciences team. This multi-faceted position will conduct data analysis and data validation to tell a story that disseminates key insights to drive the business.  Does this sound like you?  Experienced with healthcare data and strong analytic and quantitative skills Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced and challenging environment Enjoy working with multiple data sources and write SQL queries to extract the data, use tools like Python to gain efficiencies, and tools like Excel or Tableau to organize, sort and summarize the data What You'll Do: Learn and understand Phreesia’s data landscape, leveraging that knowledge to answer questions, solve problems and improve processes Conduct both ad-hoc analysis for cross-departmental requests as well as develop and maintain ongoing reporting for numerous internal initiatives Analyze and interpret data, producing clear and compelling reports for different audiences, communicating recommendations to various levels of management Leverage SQL and Excel to organize and aggregate data and summarize for reporting, handling large and complex datasets in different formats and identifying opportunities for data product improvements Trace through and perform quality assurance on queries and find efficiencies in coding using tools such as Python, Jupiter Notebooks Collaborate with team members and leadership to proactively identify business patterns through quantitative data analysis What You'll Bring: BSc/BA in Health Informatics, Public Health, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related discipline 2+ years of healthcare experience in data or business analysis Detail oriented with strong problem solving and analytical skills Strong SQL skills, and experience with Python and data visualization tools (i.e Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI) Ability to reconcile and analyze large data sets to extract key metrics and identify trends Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a cross-functional environment Nice to Have: Experience with R Who We Are:At Phreesia, we’re looking for smart and passionate people to help drive our mission of creating a better, more engaging healthcare experience. We’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in an ever-evolving landscape by transforming the way healthcare is delivered. Our SaaS platform digitizes appointment check-in and offers tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing, and enhance clinical care.Phreesia cares about our employees by providing a diverse and dynamic work environment. We’re a five-time winner of Modern Healthcare Magazine’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare award and we’ve been recognized on the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index. We are dedicated to continuously improving our employee experience by launching new programs and initiatives. If you thrive in a culture of recognition, value inclusivity, professional development, and growth opportunities, Phreesia could be a great fit! Top-rated Employee Benefits:100% Remote work + home office expense reimbursementsCompetitive compensation + equity grants for all employeesUnlimited PTO + 8 company holidaysMonthly allowance for cell phone + internet + wellness100% Paid 12-week parental leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous parental benefit to our employees in CanadaVariety of insurance coverage for people (and pets!)Continuing education and professional certification reimbursementWe strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Analyst
description: SMPL Technologies Data Analyst - Software Development  Job SummarySMPL Technologies, Inc. is looking for a dynamic, highly motivated, and experienced Consultant to fill in the role of Data Analyst in our Software Development and Data Analytics Practice. The ideal candidate will be energetic, creative, enthusiastic, intelligent, analytical, and eager to take on responsibility and learn new skills, with a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience with managing existing databases and developing new data analytics tools for clients. The analyst’s duties will include working closely with clients to develop custom analysis solutions. maintaining existing reports, administering client databases, and helping manage ETL processes.Candidates must have at least Bachelor’s a degree or similar experience and be able to produce high-quality work with little supervision. Further, candidates must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ideal candidates will be creative, possess excellent problem-solving skills, be able to build excellent data analysis reports, and be able to read and write basic, procedural code.You will enjoy working in a fast paced and agile organization, and creating an exciting, fun, teamwork-oriented environment. We will provide you with the opportunity of a lifetime. You provide enthusiasm, a good work ethic, and the ability to learn quickly.SMPL provides an incredible family culture with a focus on learning and mentoring. We are looking for a candidate who will thrive in such an environment, working with the latest technologies and on complex problems with a talented team.Analyst Responsibilities:Develop high-quality, robust, and reusable data analysis solutions given client specifications and requirementsMaintain existing SQL and write new SQL as requiredWork with clients to incorporate feedback into reports and to quickly iterateDevelop robust data models to enable clients’ own data analysisWork with developers to manage clients’ ETL processes to ensure complete and accurate dataDocument database procedures and ETL processesWork with team members and clients to diagnose issues as they ariseAnalyst Requirements:Bachler's degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance, or related fieldHigh-level data analysis and data modeling skillsSolid understanding of relational database design and database managementExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work with clients, vendors, and coworkersDatabase skills: SSMS, T-SQL, SSISReport writing skills: SSRS, Tableau, Power BI, Crystal ReportsStrong proficiency with Excel and VBAOther coding skills: Ability to read and write procedural code (Python, R, VBA, C#, .NET, Java)Preferred Analyst Qualifications:Process documentation experienceBasic knowledge or experience of database administration and managementBasic understanding of Windows authentication, groups, processes, and servicesAdditional Requirements· Ability to work from the office as well as work remotely· Ability to travel to client sites in the New York Metro AreaBenefitsYou'll love working at SMPL Technologies not just for the usual benefits, but for our environment and culture!· You'll work with a great group of people in a highly collaborative team and results oriented atmosphere· You'll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and extremely positive environment where there is always the opportunity to challenge your skills and make a difference for our customers.We provide a comprehensive benefits program including Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, 401(k) Plan, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage, Generous Vacation, Company Paid Holidays, and Training and Development Opportunities.SMPL Technologies offers a compensation package consisting of a competitive base salary and bonus structure, as well as benefits including health, vision, and dental insurance (including dependents), life insurance, 401(k) plan with generous company match, short- and long-term disability insurance, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, business-casual dress policy, and training and development opportunities.

title: Data Analyst
description: If you’re a creative analytical thinker who wants to build the reports of the future, take forecasting to the next level, and can look beyond the data to tell a story, then keep reading!For more than 140 years, Jockey has been providing families with quality and comfort they can trust, and will continue to be there for generations to come. The inspirational stories of our everyday heroes exemplify our values of authenticity, courage, hope and family.Jockey is committed to quality and innovation, and the passionate pursuit to satisfy the human need for comfort continues to be the company’s hallmark. Jockey products are sold in more than 145 countries, making us one of the most well-known apparel brands around the world.Our friendly, passionate team wants to meet logical thinkers with a creative side who like to create reports, explain what it means and why it matters. The Data Analyst will be responsible for improving the quality of, access to, and insight capabilities of the reporting tools in Jockey’s Supply Chain team. In this role, you will work with multiple data sources and analysis platforms, while creating and maintaining tools to answer the most pressing supply chain questions. The project focus will be on Descriptive and Diagnostic Analysis, which culminate in tools with Predictive Analysis in mind.This role is located at our global headquarters in #Kenosha WI (near #Milwaukee WI and #Chicago IL) and we are excited to meet you in person!The ideal individual will be responsible for:Development of intuitive, user friendly reports and tools to answer complex questionsLeverage knowledge of analytics tools to automate and streamline manual processesBecome an expert in how the Supply Chain team works to anticipate reporting needsAssist with building queries through Microsoft SQL Server and Google BigQueryQuery structured and unstructured data and perform exploratory data analysisDiligent about data validation to ensure accuracy and consistencyAssist with Logility maintenance including loading forecast information and data managementHelp with Logility troubleshooting and problem resolution with the forecasting teamContribute to training sessions and answer questions for new and existing users of reporting toolsSatisfy Ad Hoc requests for informationContribute to a collaborative and growth focused team environment by working with other members of the Supply Chain team to achieve goalsDevelop and maintain statistical processes and incorporate into analysisEssential Experience:Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Economics, Finance, Computer Science or Statistics1-3 Years ExperienceSoftware Experience:Excel pivot tables and power queryTableau or other data visualization softwareMicrosoft SQL Server or another SQL platformBonus Experience:Tableau is our favorite visualization software, but we are fans of PowerBI and encourage applicants with experience in programs similar to apply!Exposure to analytic tours, Stata, Python and/or DBTSQL Server or another SQL platform is helpfulFounded in 1876, Jockey International, Inc. is a privately held, family owned company with headquarters in #Kenosha WI. Started by Rev. Samuel T. Cooper as a sock company to serve lumberjacks of the day, the company has expanded into one of the most well-known apparel brands around the world. Today, Jockey products are sold in more than 145 countries. Jockey is committed to quality and innovation, and the passionate pursuit to satisfy the human need for comfort continues to be the company’s hallmark. Visit Jockey.com to experience the quality and craftsmanship of the Original American Underwear brand.What We Stand For:Jockey’s culture reflects the values of our leadership. Success is achieved through hard work, mutual respect, and offering consumers products with striking quality and style from a brand they trust. Jockey associates and Jockey products are the genuine article.Jockey International, Inc., and its subsidiaries, provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at hum

title: Associate Data Analyst
description: The purpose of the Data Specialist role is to deliver information from various systems to D&A leadership.  They are responsible for reporting and dashboard creation, changes and additions that allow the business to make strategy decisions.  They also support applications that are key in providing information for dashboard and analytic reporting.   Making an Impact •    Collect and analyze user feedback on data to improve reporting and Data & Analytics COE.  •    Ensure a high level of data integrity by validating data, addressing data errors and making corrections as needed.  •    Troubleshoot applications that are used to provide data for analytics  •    Infrastructure maintenance on BAU (business as usual) databases that run every day and connect/aggregate with each other. These DBs should feed seamlessly via plumbing.  •    Document, understand, and manage these data collection workflows, scheduled processes, etc.  •    Review scheduled workflows and their troubleshooting based on a preestablished set of criteria and processes. Modify and continuously improve the workflows and troubleshooting process, building on the preestablished flows.  Document and catalog the process. •    Follow the flow of data, validate at each intersection, identify breakages, troubleshoot, and escalate to the proper owner if/when needed.  •    Support the data governance arm of D&A team.  •    Create documentation of infrastructure, metrics, and how the systems are designed. Catalog and inventory that documentation. Sharing Expertise     •    Aid with the transformation of data analytics and measuring business success or areas for improvement.Gaining Exposure •    Work in our matrixed organization to appropriately route info and issues as needed to the appropriate stakeholders.   •    For completed projects, train the appropriate party in the use of the data gathering sites and answer questions on an ongoing basis Your Typical Day     •    Provide dashboard updates as required by D&A leaders  •    Research data anomalies and suggest changes to D&A leaders  •    Provide support to applications as requested  •    Create and  present reports covering workflow and workflow disruptions, exceptions, costs and analysis results.  Other accountabilities as assigned

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description: Current EmployeesIf you are a current employee at Ryder (not a Contractor or temporary employee through a staffing agency), please click here (http://wd5.myworkday.com/ryder/d/task/1422$3.htmld) to log in to Workday to apply using the internal application process. To learn how to apply for a position using the Career worklet, please review this quick reference guide (https://rydersystems.service-now.com/sys\attachment.do?sys\id=a39f83621bd99050632a4223cd4bcb91) .Job Seekers can review the Job Applicant Privacy Policy by clicking HERE. (https://ryder.com/job-applicant-privacy-policy)You are the driving force behind our company.Start your career with Ryder today!SummaryThe Data Analyst role is to deliver a final business solution to the operations team through a Power Bi experience. The Data Analyst's technical skills will be put to the test as they shape data into a crispy design through a smooth user experience. Over time the Data Analyst will become a domain expert of supply chains and their use cases. This position will work on cutting edge data technology as a key user on Ryder's Azure Data Lake driving the analytics initiatives. Design critical analytical dashboards, reports and queries to drive strategic business decisions, ad-hoc analysis and identify descriptive and prescriptive solutions for internal Ryder teams and external customers. Dig deep into the core issues of business problems in order to drive a solution that gets at the heart of the causative problem. On this team, the Data Analyst will get the chance to be the expert of supply chain solutions, collaborating with Data Analysts and Scientists, using all the skills in order to exploit data to drive the business forward. This will push the envelope of what is possible within the big data space; streaming live data into a data lake and experimenting with data in the data sandbox.Essential FunctionsDevelop Dashboards by understanding business needs, interpret the integrated data and translate this into usable visualizations to drive business decisions, interpreting results and how to utilize the dashboardsEngage the business, evaluating their needs and ad-hoc requests to prioritize product efforts creating new innovative solutionsKnowledge of the Ryder Business, understanding the complexity of the supply chain world and the role that data has within this ecosystemEnhance data maturity and integration to standardize the core value add functionality enabling a multiplier effectAdditional ResponsibilitiesPerforms other duties as assigned.Skills And AbilitiesExperience developing BI solutions with tools like: Power BI TableauExposure using tools like: ETL tools (Alteryx or SSIS) Data manipulation tools (SQL) Object oriented development stacks (.net) (preferred)Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business termsSupport product innovation, working closely with technology throughout the build, test, and release of the product using agile methodologiesQualificationsBachelor's degree required Supply Chain, Data Analytics or equivalentMaster's degree preferred Supply Chain, Data Analytics, MBA or equivalentTwo (2) years or more Applied Project(s) Experience: Experience in demonstrating, digital transformation, data management in an educational/project or intern type environment requiredTwo (2) years or more 2-4 years experience in creating dashboards for diagnostic analysis across the business. Experience working in a cloud environment a plus. preferredDOT Regulated: NoJob Category: Data Science & AnalyticsRyder is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.Job Seekers can review the Job Applicant Privacy Policy by clicking HERE. title: ICQA Data Analyst
description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONAt Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.Key job responsibilitiesResponsibilitiesPartner with the program team to create key performance indicators and new methodologies for measurement.Understand drivers, impacts on key influences on business dynamics and productivity.Translate data into actionable insights for the stakeholders.Automate reporting for weekly business metrics; identify areas of opportunity to automate and scale ad-hoc analyses.Basic Qualifications2+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel.1+ years experience extracting and processing data using SQL.1+ years project management experiencePreferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Supply Chain or related field.3+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling.Experience conducting advanced statistical analysis (skilled in using one or more of R/SPSS/SAS/Python and etc.).Excellent communication (verbal, written, and data presentation) and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment.Software development experience / Coding knowledgeAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A2129090

title: Quality Data Analyst
description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover impactful work, innovative thinking and a culture dedicated to working the right way, for the right reasons - with the customer always top of mind. The work we do matters, like helping customers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe and delivering COVID-19 solutions. As the world leader in serving science, with the largest investment in R&D in the industry, our colleagues are empowered to realize their full potential as part of a fast-growing, global organization.Location/Division Specific InformationThis role is a remote role in the LSLPG Group.How will you make an impact?In this role the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for capturing and organizing quality related data into relevant reports; analyzing data for trends requiring action; developing, automating, and improving reporting and querying capabilities using various software tools. You will provide business support for key IT Systems used in Quality, including User support and communication, testing and validation. Your expertise in data management, reporting, and analysis will support quality and compliance initiatives across a broad scope of our Organization.Gather, analyze, prepare, summarize and present quality related data, results and trendsMake routine updates and revisions to analysis methods, queries, and reportsAutomate routine tasks for improved speed and accuracyAuthor and revise global SOPs and Work InstructionsSupport IT Systems management in the areas of User support and communication, testing, and validationSupport compliance and quality improvement initiativesHow will you get here?EducationBachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Biological Science or other related field Experience1-3 years of related quality or operations experience. Solid understanding of key operational quality processes, with data management and data analysis experienceKnowledge, Skills, AbilitiesStrong computer skills with an emphasis in data analysis using software tools such as Excel, Teams, SharePoint, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), IBM Cognos, and SAP Business ObjectsStrong data management skills including data analysis, data standardization, data clean up, data queries, and data consolidationWorks effectively in a team environmentExercises leadership, initiative, and self-sufficiency while keeping management and partners appropriately involved and informed.Ability to solve practical problems and work with a variety of variables in unique situationsManages multiple tasks in a given work day; requiring interactions with personnel throughout the worldOur Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued!Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Accessibility/Disability AccessJob Seekers with a Disability: Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations in the job application process. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker with a disability, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.This telephone line is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes, such as not being able to get into the career website, following up on an application, or other non-disability related technical issues will not receive a response.

title: Entry Level Data Analyst
description: ResponsibilitiesWork hand-in-hand with the business side of an organization to help in process improvements.Working primarily on design and analysis in the areas of organization, planning cum information technology.Works as the middle man between the technical team and business team so as to assist in the development of requirements needed for the business.He/ She will be responsible for documenting customer requirements as outlined by the business users.The analyst’s role also includes making sure that the designs meet the company’s technical standards.Qualification And ExperienceEntry Level / Fresh Graduates / Engineers - BS / MS in Business/Data Analytics, Management Information systems, Computer Science ,Software engineering, IT, Industrial Engineering/Engineering management.Prior experience is a "plus" but not required.Candidates with strong communication/presentation skills, strong aptitude to learn and interest in Software programming, Testing or Business Analysis.Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the US

title: Data Analyst
description: This is a fantastic opportunity to work with one of the top tech companies in the world! Our client is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team working with internal data. Some of the job responsibilities will include writing SQL code to make tables and compare data sets, hand-in-hand making dashboards, and creating mockups.This is a mostly remote opportunity! this person will sit remote but come into the nearest apple office for meetings etc. (once or twice a month) Must-haves- Either very strong experience with SQL or Tableau-Great communication skills-Egar to hit the ground running on a project This is a remote role that may require you to go into the nearest apple office for meetings etc.**NO C2C***

title: Data Analyst
description: Job DescriptionWho We ArePAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKElevate Outdoor Collective is an alliance of iconic outdoor and winter sports brands with a specialized focus on skiing, snowboarding and snowshoeing. With each unique brand maintaining its own individual points of view and driving independent innovation, the Collective is fueled with the strength of world-class development facilities and engineers, global distribution channels and committed outdoor lifestyle enthusiasts and experts. Our brands include K2 Skis, K2 Snowboards, Marker, Dalbello, Völkl, RIDE Snowboards, LINE Skis, Backcountry Access, Atlas Snow Shoe Co., Tubbs Snowshoes, Madshus and K2 Skates.PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKWith an international portfolio of world-renowned brands recognized as trailblazers in innovation, performance and, most importantly, fun times by active lifestyle enthusiasts across the globe, Elevate Outdoor Collective will continue its mission to progress the culture of each and every outdoor endeavor it represents. As One Team backed by world-class development facilities and product engineers, incredibly talented athletes and ambassadors and a top-notch crew of employees who live and breathe the outdoor active lifestyle, Elevate Outdoor Collective is eager to take things to the next level.PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPosition PurposePAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKElevate Outdoor Collective is seeking an individual to help support our priority initiative on creating a best in class direct to customer online experience. The purpose of this roll is to support our DTC team as its main point of contact for reporting, budgeting and valued added analysis. The successful candidate will have multiple years of analytical experience including sales and inventory forecasting, large data set analysis and BI dashboard experience using Tableau/PowerBI. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKThis person should be highly motivated on creating structure and processes for driving analytical decision-making. They should bring a sense of curiosity and excitement to the organization to help solve problems with past experiences and data. The candidate should be an excellent communicator and be able to work cross departmentally in a matrix environment. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKEssential Job DutiesPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKSupport forecasting, budgeting and analysis needs of our business partners. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKCollaborate with cross functional teams to drive company initiatives with analytical trends and forecasting insightPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKCreate and enhance data visualization dashboards for teams to make data driven decisionsPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKYou will help support the online store front with inventory trend analysis PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKWorking with large data sets from many different systemsPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKYou will enhance and create data for historical and forecasting purposesPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKSupport web site analytics to improve customer experiences and processesPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKWho You Are PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKAnalytical, with meticulous attention to detail, and a passion for making data-driven decisions. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKSkilled at dealing with ambiguity. Demonstrates flexibility in a changing work environment. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKExcellent communication skills; written, verbal, and non-verbal (body language). PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKWorks well in a collaborative environment with multiple teams, both business and technical. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKStrong problem-solving skills; able to anticipate, identify, and solve business problems. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKDesire and ability to investigate and learn new tools, with a drive for ongoing self-education. PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKPossess a positive, can-do attitude and ability to contribute to high performing teams.PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAKExcellent work ethic and enthusiasm.PAGE-BREAKPAGE-BREAK

title: Data Analyst
description: wikiHow is looking to hire a Data Analyst. In this role, you will collaborate directly with a senior member of our team and others at wikiHow on a variety of data analysis projects, helping to guide content strategy, product decisions, and SEO efforts. Your work will help wikiHow more effectively serve millions of readers a day.This is a full-time, remote position. Employees will work pacific time hours and be located in one of the following states: California, Oregon, or Washington. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis upon hire. wikiHow will not provide visa sponsorship for this position.This role is unique because you will:Use your knowledge of data and statistics to help guide and inform the Content experimentation life cycle. You will be designing and analyzing trustworthy experiments that drive growth and engagement.Consult with multiple teams at wikiHow to help them evaluate their work through rigorous reporting and exploratory analysis.Gather, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to measure content performance, drive business outcomes, and identify new site opportunities.Craft reports and visualizations to communicate findings to multiple teams including senior leadership.You are right for this job if you have:A bachelor’s degree in a STEM field OR 2+ years of analytical experience.A deep understanding of statistics, especially experimentation and causal inference.Experience formulating, running, and sharing complex analyses, including different types of experiments and other exploratory analysis work.2+ years of experience in R through undergraduate OR professional experiences. Excellent knowledge of the tidyverse ecosystem (dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, etc).Experience using R to wrangle data, craft data visualizations, work with time series, and interface with APIs.Experience crafting basic SQL queries.Exposure to source control management systems, like Git.Able to tackle ambiguous and undefined problems.A deep passion for web analytics and data.Great to have, but not required:Familiar with other scripting languages like Python or PHP.Experience, or an interest in, R Shiny applications.How to apply:Please share a cover letter and resume with jobs@wikihow.com. In your cover letter, tell us why you think you are the best person for this position. Those selected will be contacted with next steps.About this job:Competitive compensationFull medical, vision, and dental insurance401k with company matching, after one year of service15 days of PTO annuallyAbout wikiHow:wikiHow is the world’s leading how-to website trying to help everyone everywhere learn how to do anything. We are a mission-driven, hybrid organization that is deeply committed to making an impact in the world. We are read by more than 115 million people every month, and we’re growing! A little bit more about us:We have a super small team - less than 30 of us!We don't think working long “startup hours” is strategic or healthy. We work hard and productively, then go enjoy rich lives outside of work.We're a gender-balanced team that promotes a diverse and inclusive cultureWe love what we do! Coming to work is genuinely exciting when you work on a product that is globally ambitious and helpful.Please note: We’re a small team processing a high volume of applications. While we do review every application, we unfortunately can’t guarantee a response to every applicant. We are very grateful for your time and interest in wikiHow!wikiHow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other protected category.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.The mission of TikTok Monetization Platform is to connect global advertisers, merchants, affiliates and users to get suitable marketing solutions and conversion funnels, to maximize conversion and monetization opportunities. Our vision is to build an easy-to-understand, easy-to-use and powerful platform for onsite commerce.We are looking for data analysts to join the efforts driving monetization,- Apply expertise in data analysis and visualization to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our ads products.- Deliver data support for both short term and long term business development plans from strategic scope and execution aspects with in-depths analysis.- Work closely with key cross functional teams such as product managers, data science, and engineers to solve business problems.- Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of business products.Qualifications- Bachelor's degree with a background in Math, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields;- 3-5 years of Data Analytics.- Expert experience pulling large and complex data using SQL and writing data pipelines.- Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau);Prefer to Have- Experience doing quantitative analysis;- Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.);- Excellent verbal and written English communication skills;- Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop) a plusTikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

title: Data Analyst
description: Phreesia is looking for a  Data Analyst  who is passionate about healthcare and solving complex problems with data to join our Life Sciences team. This multi-faceted position will conduct data analysis and data validation to tell a story that disseminates key insights to drive the business. Does this sound like you?  Experienced with healthcare data and strong analytic and quantitative skills  Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced and challenging environment  Enjoy working with multiple data sources and write SQL queries to extract the data, use tools like Python to gain efficiencies , and tools like Excel or Tableau to organize, sort and summarize the data What You'll Do Learn and understand Phreesia’s data landscape, leveraging that knowledge to answer questions, solve problems and improve processes  Conduct both ad-hoc analysis for cross-departmental requests as well as d evelop and maintain ongoing reporting for numerous internal initiatives  Analyze and interpret data, producing clear and compelling reports for different audiences, communicating recommendations to various levels of management  Leverage SQL and Excel to organize and aggregate data and summarize for reporting, h andling large and complex datasets in different formats and identifying opportunities for data product improvements  Trace through and perform quality assurance on queries and f ind efficiencies in coding using tools such as Python, Jupiter Notebooks  Collaborate with team members and leadership to proactively identify business patterns through quantitative data analysis What You'll Bring BSc/BA in Health Informatics, Public Health, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related discipline  2+ years of healthcare experience in data or business analysis  Detail oriented with strong problem solving and analytical skills  Strong SQL skills, and experience with Python and data visualization tools ( i.e Tableau, Qlikview , Power BI)  Ability to reconcile and analyze large data sets to extract key metrics and identify trends  Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a cross-functional environment Nice To Have Experience with R Who We AreAt Phreesia, we’re looking for smart and passionate people to help drive our mission of creating a better, more engaging healthcare experience. We’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in an ever-evolving landscape by transforming the way healthcare is delivered. Our SaaS platform digitizes appointment check-in and offers tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing, and enhance clinical care.Phreesia cares about our employees by providing a diverse and dynamic work environment. We’re a five-time winner of Modern Healthcare Magazine’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare award and we’ve been recognized on the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index. We are dedicated to continuously improving our employee experience by launching new programs and initiatives. If you thrive in a culture of recognition, value inclusivity, professional development, and growth opportunities, Phreesia could be a great fit!Top-rated Employee Benefits100% Remote work + home office expense reimbursementsCompetitive compensation + equity grants for all employeesUnlimited PTO + 8 company holidaysMonthly allowance for cell phone + internet + wellness100% Paid 12-week parental leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous parental benefit to our employees in CanadaVariety of insurance coverage for people (and pets!)Continuing education and professional certification reimbursementWe strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics)
description: You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.Position PurposeInterpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadershipIdentify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customersManage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelinesSupport the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automationApply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic productsSupport multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partnersIndependently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate resultsCommunicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when requiredOur Comprehensive Benefits PackageFlexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibilityCompetitive payPaid Time Off including paid holidaysHealth insurance coverage for you and dependents401(k) and stock purchase plansTuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.Education/ExperienceBachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/query languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data Analyst Location: RemoteExperience : 4 to 7 yearsUSC/GC/GC-EAD JOB DESCRIPTION:Using tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data Using tools to identify, analyze, and interpret trends in data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data Working with programmers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities and propose modificationsPreparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends Developing data systems (like SQL database if need be)– reorganizing data in a readable format to be consumed by external source Thanks & Regards, Cris Phone :-916-413-7685 Technical Recruiter. Email:Cris.k@saforceit.com
