title: Data Analyst
description: At Vesta, we envision a world without e-commerce fraud. We're passionately pursuing that future by building industry leading SaaS solutions for fraud protection and guaranteed e-commerce payments to a global customer base. We are headquartered in Portland, Oregon with offices in the US, Singapore, Ireland and Mexico.Our Machine Learning team is seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join our Decisions Science team. Vesta relies on machine learning at the core of its product offerings which help our e-commerce customers maximize revenue and minimize fraud. As a data analyst on the decision sciences team, you will work as part of a cross-functional team of data analysts, fraud analysts, and data scientists to explore data, identify and quantify fraud patterns, perform feature engineering and to make production changes. You'll work with the latest cloud technologies to create end-to-end fraud solutions for our customers across the globe.Core Responsibilities:Work as part of the Decision Science team to maximize approved transactions while minimizing fraud losses.Perform data analysis and create visualizations.Analyze large volume of transactions to find 'fraudulent' and 'good' patterns and turn them into features or rules.Analyze large volume of transactions to provide 'insights' that will add values to our decisioning.Create reporting, visualizations and conduct data queries per requests from internal stakeholders.Deploy production changesPerform deep-dive analysis of the data to understand performance, areas of improvement and customer winsWork as a cross-disciplinary team with data scientists, engineers, product and operations to solve complex problemsEducation & Skills:Bachelor's degree.4+ years of relevant experience in data and fraud analyticsStrong SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries and build dashboardsPython or other programming language to perform more complex analysesExperience with Apache Spark and Cloud technologies a strong plusSoftware engineering practices (git, unit testing, CI/CD) a plusBonus: Experience with fraud detection, Fintech/financial services, or related problems (money laundering, cybersecurity, etc.)Other:On occasion this role may require off-hours work in order to address escalations or urgent concerns.About VestaVesta is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company that specializes in managing payments in the "card-not-present" (CNP) arena. We use next-level technologies and cutting-edge data science methodologies to bring unparalleled accuracy to fraud detection. Our zero liability solutions let merchants step fearlessly into the world of online commerce, so they can stop chargebacks—without stopping business.We are a company reinventing ourselves for the future in an industry that is growing and changing at the same time. We are looking for talented people to join us who resonate with our Vesta Values: trust, partner, empower, passion and courage -- and who love to tackle new challenges every day.We are also a casual, fun and flexible workplace that also offers highly competitive benefits including a selection of medical, dental and vision care options, paid parental leave, generous paid-time-off and a paid sabbatical program.Vesta is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, or disability.

title: Data Analyst
employment_type: Business Development, Information Technology, and Analyst
description: About GelatoGelato has built the world's largest and most global networks for on-demand production of customized items such as apparel, wall art, drinkware, stationary, and many others. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We already have more than 100 production partners in 30 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.In many ways, we at Gelato are rethinking how digital fabrication of customized products can be done on-demand. Just imagine what will happen when we add 3D printing capabilities to this global service. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. Again, thanks to the products being produced locally we produce what you need when you need it, and where you need it. In other words, we reduce waste and carbon emissions.Together we can increase global GDP by effectively supporting local on-demand production.The positionWe are seeking analytics professionals with a true passion for data and business impact to join our world-class data team. As a Data Analyst at Gelato, you will shape the future of the business, its core services, and/or products. You will collaborate on a wide array of business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Operations, Data Engineering, Marketing, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve Gelato’s biggest challenges. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them. You will guide teams using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner for your business stakeholders.The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), Madrid (Spain), Talin ( Estonia), Moscow (Russia), and Kiev (Ukraine)What you will be doingOwn the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility.Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.Frame and carry out statistical experiments to test impact of new initiatives.Partner with business teams to define and track goals around key operational and financial metrics.Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.Who you areGraduate with a degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Informatics, Mathematics, Economics or a related technical discipline.2 years+ of relevant experience with data modeling, business analysis, and reporting.Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.Experience in cleaning, manipulating and analyzing data in Python or R (Pandas, Numpy, Dplyr).Basic knowledge of statistics, experimentation and statistical modeling. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Experience communicating with cross-functional stakeholders and working in collaborative environments.Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects.Customer obsessed, highly analytical, with a bias for objective measurement, facts, and reasoning.Self-starter, hands-on, and comfortable operating in a rapidly changing environment.Aptitude to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business analysis and reporting.Preferred QualificationsMasters degree in analytics or data science.Experience in management consulting. Hands-on experience with Looker.What we offerWe offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.Some of the highlights of the package include:Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvementChance to become a shareholder of Gelato!Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotelyAnd much much more!What it’s like to work at GelatoWe are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission.We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

title: Data Analyst
description: Who are we?At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.What You Will Do Conduct data analysis on our game projects (including analysis on game products, commercialization, operation, marketing, etc.). Build an analysis and reporting system on routine data performance to provide business insights. Track and maintain data integrity across tools and workflows; identify and resolve data inconsistencies. Cooperate with other team members to collect data required for analysis. Support user research in the SEA region and conduct data analysis.What You Will Need BA/BS degree in a major related to Data Analytics. 2+ years of experience in data analytics; experience in the game industry is preferred. Expertise in Microsoft Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau (or similar dashboard tools). Experience in decision-making and change management driven by data analysis and user research. Passion for playing and creating games; enthusiasm in anime is preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Chinese is a must to communicate effectively with Shanghai Headquarters.We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

title: E-commerce data analyst
description: About us:The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join our product and operations team, together we can build an e-commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users. 1. Overall responsible for data support of e-commerce overseas operation module;2. Daily output and follow up the data output of the whole operation and each module;3. Operation core index design, data dashboard design landing, core index data abnormal monitoring;4. Data analysis and follow-up of operation activities in overseas countries;5. In depth analysis of business, user, commodity and other data, and provide to the operation team to support the operation strategy;6. Follow up the local operation work overseas, support the operation effect and give the follow-up optimization suggestions;7. Cooperate with product / operation / R & D, promote the implementation of optimization scheme, and bring about the actual improvement and growth of business;8. Responsible for all kinds of a / b experiment design and analysis;9. Analysis of the overall overseas market and business operation of a certain country.Requirement: 1. Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation；2. Proficient in SQL, can use Python or R for data analysis；3. At least 3 years of working Experience in e-commerce business and analysis is preferred；4. Overseas business experience or analytical experience is preferred；5. Able to write requirement documents in English and communicate with global staff;6. Have a strong learning ability and curiosity; quickly familiar with and start new business;7. Have a strong ability to work under pressure, have the courage to overcome difficulties and accept challenges.

title: Data Analyst
description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.The Business Intelligence team partners closely with the management team/business functions to understand their needs and then meet these needs by analyzing and translating relevant data into meaningful, actionable outputs.ResponsibilitiesData Partner for Business StakeholdersCollaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data requirementsMine data and conduct analysis using a variety of analytical methodologies to identify trends, patterns and correlationsConcisely communicate analytical findings and recommendations to stakeholdersDevelop solutions, mainly in the form of reporting/monitoring tools, to address identified business needsTrain business users on developed data toolsData ProjectsIdentify business areas or gaps whereby data solutions can potentially generate stepwise improvements to organizational outcomesConduct analysis to quantify potential benefit to organization, subsequently presenting to key stakeholders to obtain buy-inDevelop data-driven solutions to drive desired outcomesBe involved in the implementation of the solution, ensuring alignment to ground processes and business needsQuantify and develop success matrices to determine success/ impact of projectMaintenance of Reports & Monitoring ToolsPeriodically conduct quality checks on dashboards and reporting tools, ensuring that data logics are updated and relevant to current business needsRequirements0 - 3 years of experience in data analytics, with demonstrated results in product/process improvement initiativesBachelor’s degree preferably in a quantitative major: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics, or related fields with a strong academic recordFundamental SQL query experience is requiredExperience with Python, R (or other tools for statistical analysis) and data visualization tools will be a plusHigh level of self-motivation, with strong desire to deliver quality work that does not compromise with personal standardsSharp analytical abilities and a structured, data-driven approach to clarifying, scoping and solving problemsWell-developed interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills, able to convince and manage stakeholders through logical, data-driven methodologiesHigh level of organizational and time management skills, and attention to detailSubmit a job applicationBy applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. title: Data Analyst
description: Building a Safer Cyberspace: At Horangi, we’re passionate about building a safer cyberspace and creating software that solves challenging cybersecurity problems. Horangi focuses on building partnerships with our customers, developing an understanding of their business goals and building a security strategy that helps achieve their objectives. Horangi’s personnel have an extensive engineering experience and strong background in penetration testing and strategic consulting, partnering both large multinational networks and small organizations with focused missions. We enjoy solving tough security problems and we are eager to find new challenges and build new relationships. Get to know the roleTo develop and maintain automated reports (Python, SQL) and dashboards (Google DataStudio) for teams (both local and regional) to measure performance. Work closely with various teams within Horangi (Leadership, Marketing, Finance, Sales, etc.) to understand data requirements, identify and set-up systems to report and track key metrics. The day to day activitiesDevelop and maintain dashboards for teams to track and optimize performanceSupport a broad range of analytics projects, such as campaign and channel optimization, sales pipeline coverage, revenue recognition, etc. Develop data visualizations and present results to internal stakeholdersContribute to improving data quality and data reporting processes The must havesBachelor's degree in Statistics, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering or other quantitative subjects are requiredKnowledge of analytical tools, including Excel, database querying (SQL), relational databasesSome experience with PythonExperience with data visualization tools, such as Google DataStudio - preferredFast learner, ability to acquire new technical skills as neededStrong communication skillsVersatile, self-driven, detail-orientedFull professional working proficiency in the English language is requiredFounded by ex-Palantir Technologies engineers, Horangi prides itself as being the Cloud Security Champions in Asia backed by a team of global cybersecurity experts and trusted by industry leaders such as Gojek, MoneySmart, PropertyGuru and Tiket.com.We built our Cloud Security product using AWS technology and cloud best practices to provide the security, performance and reliability of our platform as we ship rapidly in our agile software development. We adopt an event-driven architecture and embrace serverless technologies that are backed with 100% infrastructure as code. We build our app using reliable tools and frameworks that our team knows and trusts, including Python, Docker, TypeScript, React and GraphQL.Horangi has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture, and we look for people who are curious, inventive and work to be a little better every single day. We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and get-things-done culture. Horangi is always looking to hire collaborative, humble and highly driven individuals who want to make a difference.Level yourself up as a cloud security expert and do the best work of your life here at Horangi.

title: Data Analyst - Graduate Programme
description: There are thousands of graduates in the market — Stand out from the crowd! Technology is transforming all our lives – developments in robotics, automation, artificial intelligence and big data are creating the careers of the future. Digital careers need intelligent, analytical minds, people who want to make a difference; graduates who desire to be at the forefront of change.  Regardless of your degree subject, we believe all graduates possess the skills to fuel an exciting career in technology. We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in Data Engineering.As a Junior Data Engineering Consultant, you will design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using the latest Big data technologies. You will be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members. You will be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle and will work through challenging and interesting problems. Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizations such as Standard Chartered Bank, DBS, RHB and ANZ to name a few.Once you’ve completed your training, you will work on client site on innovative technology projects, collaborating with stakeholders across the business and developing software solutions that shape our digital future.  We help thousands of graduates each year start their tech careers and fast-track their career progression. We welcome applications from all degree disciplines. You don't need a STEM degree, but you must be passionate about starting a career in tech and have a good aptitude for IT.  What we offer you: Industry-recognised training, covering both technical and professional skills, to ensure you are business ready. Opportunity to work with our market leading clients as part of their integrated teams. Comprehensive support and development programme throughout your entire FDM career journey including continued professional development, mentoring and networking events.  We ask you have the following: University degree (bachelor or higher) Eligibility to work in Singapore Exemplary communication skills and demonstrable interest and desire to work in technology Ability to commit to the full 2-year graduate careers programme  About FDM: FDM is the market leader in the Recruit, Train and Deploy sector, launching the careers of thousands of graduates, just like you, every year.  Our purpose is to create and inspire exciting careers that shape our digital future. We want to make sure that the opportunity for a career in tech is available to everyone and we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Despite COVID-19, we launched 1,200+ careers globally in 2020.  The FDM Graduate Programme starts with training at the FDM Singapore Academy. Following this, you will be placed with one or more of our clients to work as part of their team as an FDM Consultant for a period of two years.  After the two years, you can continue your journey with FDM, you may be offered a permanent position with the client, or you can pursue other opportunities.  With centres across APAC, Europe and North America, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer. In 2021, we received the GradSingapore Top 100 Graduate Employers award.  To find out more about us, follow us on social #FDMcareers.  At FDM it’s ‘business as usual’, we are recruiting now and throughout the year. Due to COVID-19 we have implemented alternative working arrangements to ensure that all our people stay safe. These consist of remote working, virtual training, video interviewing, and access to webinars and virtual events. We have training start dates happening throughout the year. If you’re looking to start your career in technology or business, we want to hear from you now!

title: Data Analyst
description: Company DescriptionPluang is a technology driven Indonesian wealth-tech investment company. Founded in 2019, Pluang’s mission is to democratize finance for all. We believe that everyone should have access to the financial markets, so we’ve built Pluang from the ground up to make investing friendly, approachable, and understandable for newcomers and experts alike. You will need to write custom queries to pull data to support your assumption and hypothesisExperience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and Looker)Experience with scripting and data analysis programming languages such as Python (numpy, scipy, pandas) or R programming languagesSolid understanding of statistical analysisStrong sense of ownership and accountability, with good attention to detailGood interpersonal skills and ability to work well in an international team environmentAbility to be agile and flexible in adapting in a dynamic environmentInterest in the investment or financial sector is a plus

title: Data Analyst / Senior Data Analyst
description: Reports To: Manager, Data AnalyticsRelationships: APAC Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Management and Data Science teams; APAC,international and global business functionsPurpose of positionThe Data Analyst is a pivotal role in a new divisional analytics organization supporting all APAC functionsand markets in the areas of Business Intelligence, Data Management, Data Analytics, and Data Science.This is a challenging role that supports APAC business functions and processes with applied analytics.Your role will be to investigate key business problems, discover insights and recommend improvementactions through data mining, statistical analysis and data visualization techniques. Next to that you willsupport other business functions and strategic projects with finding and understanding data, usertraining and coaching.Areas of responsibility1 - Data analysis: Support key APAC business processes with applied analytics Identify what data is needed, available and relevant to the problem Design and develop strategic methods for data collection and analysis Integrate and prepare datasets; title: Regional Data Analyst
description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.The Regional Data Analyst partners with business units, providing analytical support to help them achieve their objectives. Whether it's A/B testing product features, analysing the key drivers of operational performance or uncovering areas of cost improvement, the Data Analyst masters both the data and business domains to play a key role in decision-making. To note that there are different levels of data analysts within the team and the job roles are different.ResponsibilitiesWork with stakeholders to define business and information needsLiaise with stakeholders to identify issues and how analytics can help resolve such issuesSupport the translation of business needs into analytics and reporting requirementsSupport projects across the region, being involved on the ground Recommend types of data and data sources neededThink ahead and propose what new data sources should be made available to enhance the analysesGather data from internal systems and external sourcesClean databases to remove duplicated, outdated or irrelevant informationPerform data validation and quality control checksMine data to identify trends, patterns and correlationsDevelop solutions and recommendations to address information needDesign data reports and visualisation tools (dashboards) to facilitate data understandingRequirementsBachelor degree in a quantitative major: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics1 - 3 years (data analyst) of experience in analytics and product / process improvement-related initiatives. Experience with SQL, Python, R (or other tools for statistical analysis) and data visualization tools a plusGood understanding of analytics and computational modelling, business needs analysis, data visualization & stakeholder managementAbility to display a structured thought process Submit a job applicationBy applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

title: Data Analyst - Data Cycling Center
description: Responsibilities Background on DCC TeamGiven the rapidly accelerating growth of ByteDance around the world, we are in the midst of creating a revolutionary platform for ByteDance products. The Data Cycling Centre (DCC), being the AI partner of Global Business Solution (GBS), uncovers white spaces within the organisation to create breakthroughs in the current process and strategic roadmap. Set on helping business owners make smarter decisions and providing industry-leading innovations to simplify and automate workflows, DCC uses quantitative and qualitative data to guide and uncover insights, turning our findings into real products to power exponential growth.Job DescriptionAs a Data Analyst, you will support multiple project teams on their quantitative and qualitative needs. This can range from sourcing data and building dashboards to running analysis and liasing with DB owners. You will also manage team level (DCC) data needs like setting up and managing databases, documenting data assets and requesting additional CPU and memory resources. Responsibilities- Act as data expert in the team who provides support for projects through sourcing, cleaning and analyzing of data - Engage DCC projects teams to understand their needs both quantitatively and qualitatively through deep and consistent interaction - Build data tools and dashboards to aid in team's ability to extract, track, understand and leverage data- Drive change and innovation through data driven insights and actionable reccomendations- Manage and grow teams knowledge through documentation of previous work (Queries, Scripts, Dashboard etc) and present information so that it will be easy for other members to leverage independantly- Design and manage DCC's data warehouse Qualifications - Bachelor's Degree in quantitative fields such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Applied Analytics, Operations Research, Business Management, Engineering, Finance or any other relevant fields;- 2-5 years of experience in relevant field;- Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R);- Experience with large databases or Hadoop ecosystem, Machine Learning and AI technologies;- Experience with designing and managing data warehouses such as: design data model, define data metric, data governance, ETL processes and so on;- Strong communication skills in English (both oral and written);- Ability to relay technical and non-technical information in a clear and concise manner;

title: Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst Graduate Programme
description: There are thousands of graduates in the market, stand out from the crowd.Technology is transforming all our lives – developments in robotics, automation, artificial intelligence and big data are creating the careers of the future. Digital careers need intelligent, analytical minds, people who want to make a difference; graduates who desire to be at the forefront of change.Regardless of your degree subject, we believe all graduates possess the skills to fuel an exciting career in technology. FDM offers numerous career paths for you to choose. As a leading IT Graduate Employer, FDM Group is a FTSE 250 employer with a global footprint working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations such as Standard Chartered Bank, DBS, RHB and ANZ.We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in Data Engineering.How is the programme structured?Your journey as a Junior Data Engineering Consultant will begin with FDM’s Singapore Academy, where you will receive training and the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout. Our award-winning Graduate Programme provides a wealth of opportunity to gain transferable skills as well as becoming an expert within your field. After successfully completing your training, you will work with one or more of our clients in Singapore during the two-year programme.What will I be doing?As a Junior Data Engineer, you will design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using the latest Java and Big data technologies. You will be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members. You will be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle and will work through challenging and interesting problems. Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizationsWhat We Are Looking ForGraduates with a degree of 2.2 or aboveStrong analytical skillsExcellent communication skillsAbility to meet deadlines effectivelyBig ambitions to succeed within the IT industryWhat We Offer YouIndustry recognised training and qualificationsKey skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and Microsoft ExcelA foot in the door to some of the world’s most reputable organisationsMentoring and on-going support throughout your entire FDM journeySocial events and networkingWhether you’ve been studying for a role in the technology industry or not, we have exciting opportunities available for you. We have multiple start dates all year round, so why not make an application today?

title: Data Analyst (Fraud)
description: About UsShopBack : Better Shopping, Every Day.The ShopBack Group is Asia-Pacific’s leading shopping and rewards platform, serving over 30 million shoppers across ten markets. Growing from a team of six back in 2014 to over eight hundred today, ShopBackers across the region come together with a singular mission: to make shopping rewarding, delightful, and accessible for all.Joining forces with leading buy now, pay later (BNPL) player hoolah and with the launch of ShopBack Pay, the Group now offers shoppers a responsible and convenient payment option at checkout.More than half a billion shopping trips start with ShopBack each year. The Group powers over US$3.5 billion in annual sales for over 10,000 online and in-store merchant partners, across categories ranging from fashion, beauty, F&B, electronics, travel and more. If you are passionate about building and scaling up businesses in this fast-growing landscape, come and join our growing ShopBack team!About The RoleShopBack is achieving rapid growth in its core products while, in parallel, breaking new ground with the development of new product lines and strategic initiatives. One of these is the digital vouchers vertical that has enjoyed early traction and is now being scaled across the region. We are looking to bring on board a fraud analyst - someone who is passionate about fighting fraud, identifying new trends/typologies, educating ShopBack’s employees and leaders on the operational fraud risk of new markets/products. This position works closely with cross-functional stakeholders across product, engineering, operations, finance and legal.This individual should be naturally curious and passionate about risk prevention: if something seems off, you want to investigate what’s going on and solve root problems. This person should also be analytical - passionate about data analysis and can frame business decisions and tradeoffs effectively through quantitative analysis and visualization.What You'll DoDevelop and implement comprehensive payment fraud detection strategies and business rules that balance fraud loss, cost of execution, and customer experienceDive deep into our systems to monitor user accounts and payment activities to identify and predict risky behavior that could result in financial losses. Where needed, build trend reports and key indicators that serve as early warning risk indicators for potentially fraudulent activitiesLead root cause analysis in the event of fraudulent activities to identify gaps in our existing systems and processes, design and operate tools and standard operating procedures that allow us to react to fraudulent actors real-time or as fast as possibleUnderstand scheme rules and regulations and propose solutions to maintain fraud and chargeback rate within thresholds Work with Product/Engineering/QA teams to implement fraud/risk rules on payment channel integrations, internal tools and 3rd party risk/fraud management platformsWork with local commercial and operations stakeholders to customize fraud risk management techniques and rules across different country markets and across different payment methodsHandle chargeback cases by working with internal partners to provide evidence and minimize chargeback losses to the companyWhat We Look ForDegree in the fields of computer science, software engineering, information systems, or data analytics1-3 years experience at payments processor, card acquirer, or e-commerce platform to configure/analyze payment risk and write fraud rulesProficient with SQL queries and Databases designHave created impactful dashboards using various BI toolsStrong problem-solving skills: You are able to exhaustively and comprehensively break down problems in a structured manner. You are skilled at using data to drive decisionsAn excellent communicator and team player: You are able to convey complex ideas succinctly and work effectively across teamsDecisive, and open to learning: You will make many critical decisions every day impacting large numbers of customers. You are willing to make these difficult decisions and quickly learn and iterate from these experiencesResults oriented and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment requiring prioritization and ownershipAptitude to identify new ways to approach risk management and to think creatively

description: About Fazz Financial GroupFazz Financial Group is a digital financial services group founded in 2016. It is based in Southeast Asia, and is the holding group for over 10 FinTech startups, which includes PayFazz, Xfers, Modal Rakyat, StraitsX, and others.Fazz Financial Group’s mission is to enable financial access for everyone, especially within Southeast Asia, where 70% of its population is underserved.Fazz Financial Group has headquarters in Singapore and Indonesia, with 600 staff spread across regional offices in Malaysia, Taiwan, and Vietnam. title: Data Analyst
description: As our Data Analyst, you will manage all our business and consumer data and transform them into actionable insights and recommendations for the company. You will provide visibility to shoppers’ behaviors both online and offline, market trends and sales performances of our products across our local and overseas markets and platforms. The scope of work involves data mining, data analytics and interactions with cross functional teams and stakeholders from E-commerce, Retail, CRM and Customer Support.This role is highly multi-functional providing insights and analytical support to drive our Omnichannel transformation to create a seamless consumer experience across all distribution channels thereby connecting online and offline channels as well as elevating the in-store digital consumer experience. This role will report to the E-commerce team.ResponsibilitiesPerform all analytical and reporting related activities on Omnichannel transformation, digital performance, e-commerce platforms, customer database, website behavior, campaigns, CRM, loyalty, retail operations (store efficiencies, product/inventory assortment analysis).Develop dashboards to gain real time insights, provide data visualization, to allow quick access to view and monitor operational and metric performances.Propose and utilize CRM reporting tools to monitor consumer buying trends, monitor progressions and loyalty performances.Work on projects and reporting across channels to further shape the Omnichannel Reporting capabilities and landscape to drive the companies shift towards an Omnichannel experience.Present and deliver weekly / monthly / ad-hoc reports to management and key stakeholders.RequirementsPreferably 1-2 years' experience as a Data Analyst, ideally with experience in E-commerce and/or Retail environment.Familiar with data visualisation tool (Tableau, Qlik-view, Qlik-sense, Power BI) , Adobe, Google analytics or any other web analytics tool.Passion for the retail industry and the application of analytics to drive and enhance the omnichannel experience.Strong understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness.Ability to transform data effectively into meaningful information to support continued improvements, innovations and growth.Proven track record as a resourceful self-starter who is creative and comfortable working cross-functionally.Prior experience with Shopify is a plus

description: Job description:Reporting to the Head of Data Management in Singapore, we are seeking a motivated self-starter to join the Data Management team in APAC.  As a Data Analyst,  you will be crucial in ensuring the creation and support of investment products across various asset classes and various APAC markets.  You will be responsible for the accurate and timely maintenance of reference data, market data and corporate action data.   What You Will Do   intraday analysis of corporate action data relating to market events such as rights and bonus issues, dividend declarations, share consolidations, share splits, initial public offerings, share buybacks, mergers and acquisitions.  support and maintain the lifecycle of instruments such as equities, bonds, funds, indices, warrants, derivatives and structured products for APAC markets respond to data queries from both internal and external clients; liaising with stock exchanges, global customer support teams and third party data vendors. establish new data processes and quality checks to ensure continuous data quality    What You Bring  prior experience in a similar role broad knowledge of a range of asset classes as well as an understanding of the value chain of financial information.  excellent customer focus and high level of accuracy, and attention to detail strong analytical, conceptual and solution-driven mindset proactive and strong initiative in managing day to day activities curiosity for continuous learning and development, to ensure service excellence across our global products and data portfolio  fluent English (spoken and written), additional languages are a plus eg. Mandarin

title: ETF Data Analyst
description: Virtu is a leading financial firm that leverages cutting edge technology to deliver liquidity to the global markets and innovative, transparent trading solutions to our clients. As a market maker, Virtu provides deep liquidity that helps to create more efficient markets around the world. Our market structure expertise, broad diversification, and execution technology enables us to provide competitive bids and offers in over 19,000 securities, at over 235 venues, in 36 countries worldwide.THE ROLEOur Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) Block Trading desk is a globally integrated team of traders, pricing analyst and operations support that provide liquidity to hundreds of clients worldwide across multiple asset classes.Our ETF Data Analysts work closely with our traders and ETF issuers to understand products and pricing methodologies. Analysts in this role will use cutting edge tooling to build on-time, accurate, fair value models for our traders that price funds in many assets including commodities, equities, fixed income, as well as emerging asset classes like cryptocurrencies. Our ideal candidate is driven to dig in and solve problems, loves data cleaning and developing models that deliver the best results for our trading desk.Our ETF Data Analysts are a critical function of our ETF trading team. This is an excellent opportunity to become an ETF evaluation expert, make important contributions to the operations of our firm each day and join a fast-paced desk in a growing area of the financial services industry.THE CANDIDATE Excellent academic background. All subjects welcome but candidates with Data Science, Data Analytics or Actuarial degrees or related fields are a plus. Strong graduates will be considered.Programming experience is preferred (Python, SQL, Java or C++ are a plus)Highly detail-oriented problem solver that is driven by precision in their resultsAbility to complete time-sensitive work by deadlinesA physicalizer; a person who identifies issues and creates solutions without rigid direction or fanfareThe ability to communicate information preciselyHighly motivated and tenacious individual, with a proven ability to take initiative and work independently and within a teamTeam player: authentic, genuine person who is capable of working towards collective goalsNo finance background is necessary but an interest in finance is a strong preference.THE PROCESS After an initial resume screening, select applicants will receive an online programming-skills test via email. This is to gain an understanding of candidate coding abilities. The sender will be Codility, a third-party evaluation service we employ, so please be sure to monitor your inbox/spam folder. Following that, successful candidates will be contacted for a phone interview. We look forward to learning more about you.Virtu Financial is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming you for who you are and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Data Analyst
description: OverviewWaters Corporation is currently seeking a dynamic Data Analyst who can tell stories with data!The role of Data Analyst is a new role for you to make your own and support the team with translating data into real tangible insights for our 6 manufacturing sites. Working alongside our Global Manufacturing Teamthe Data Analyst will understand end user needs and implement reports and automated workflows which help to solve Manufacturing issues such as production throughput spend on raw material, and creating harmonizing process efficiencies.This is a highly visible role across our organization and would be suited to someone who is passionate about advocating change across a global footprint!Our team ensure our 6+ manufacturing sites operate effectively and efficiently and deliver our products to our customers on time. Our products are critical to our customers who use our Mass Spectrometers and Liquid Chromatography products to develop new medicinal therapies to advance human health, screen newborn blood samples and ensure the safety of our food and drink. We are proud of the work we do and how we are contributing to this important work!Responsibilities Leverage existing data to accurately describe, optimize and forecast the organizations performance enabling data driven decisions that will improve business outcomes  Use contemporary tools such as Power Platform, Power BI, Azure Synapse, and SAP to develop, and become the guardian of, the manufacturing datasets, tools, and metrics  Work and collaborate across business functions and lead multiple global and organization-wide projects which enhance capabilities, increase effectiveness, flexibility and productivity.  Bridge communication between the business stakeholders and IT, ensuring change is understood, implemented, and adopted We are striving to become a data driven, globally connected manufacturing function – come and join us on this journey and be integral to making global improvements to how we use our manufacturing data!Qualifications Experience in a manufacturing environment and demonstrable experience of using data to drive change within an organization  Knowledge and experience of SAP BA and HANA as well as Power BI, Power Platform, Power Apps and Power Automate would be preferred although we would be interested to hear from you if you have experience with other low code platforms  Logical and enterprise minded with the ability to use data to elucidate information and insight  Analytically minded and data-driven with the ability to explore the existing data to help guide the process This is a great opportunity for someone looking to develop in a global business and to really make this role their own. We value our colleagues and their development this is reflected in the fact that 25% of our open vacancies are filled by internal moves – so opportunities for development and career progression are available!Some travel between global manufacturing facilities will be occasionally requiredThe location of this role is flexible you could be based near any of our sites which includes Wilmslow- UK, Wexford-Ireland, Milford-USA and SingaporeIn addition to salary, we work flexibly, and have excellent family friendly benefits such as attractive employer pension contribution, life assurance, income protection and private medical. With Waters, there are plenty of opportunities for you to grow, develop and contribute.We are proud to be a “Best Place to Work” for equality as awarded by the European Human Rights Campaign Foundation and at Wilmslow we work with a number of partners including Stonewall, STEM Women and STEM Returners in ensuring we are an open and inclusive workplace where people can bring their whole selves to work – this is really important to us! When you join Waters you can contribute to this mission by joining our European EDI Hub!Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community.Company DescriptionWaters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials, and food sciences for more than 60 years. With more than 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Our team focuses on creating business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being. We’re all in it together delivering benefit as one to provide the insights needed today in order to solve the challenges of tomorrow.Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or protected Veteran status.

title: Oil Data Analyst
description: OverviewCastleton Commodities International (www.cci.com) is hiring an exceptional Data Analyst to join our Singapore office. You will work alongside our senior lead oil analyst in Asia and support one of our top oil portfolio manager teams. This is a front office analytical role covering the Asia oil market. The position is focused on building and maintaining financial models, performing analysis of the oil markets, and identifying trading opportunities. Bachelor’s degree from a top tier University with strong academic performance. Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science/Information Technology or related fields of study. Strong foundation in data query/manipulation of large-scale data using SQL and data visualisation tools such as Tableau, and PowerBI. Experience in model development using programming languages such as VBA, Python or R with strong knowledge of MS Excel. Individuals must be used to handling and cleaning large data sets and applying the data to models. Candidates need to have a good level of commodity knowledge. Individuals that are self-motivated and can handle a large amount of responsibility. Individuals must exhibit strong communication skills, problem solving ability and be interested in pursuing in commodity trading.

develop innovative solutions.A good degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management, Engineering and /or Masters in Business Analytics or a related field.Effective communicator who can work with diverse stakeholders to define requirements, refine data analytics use cases and present the data insights.Strong interpersonal and presentation skills and ability to manage cross cultural differences and sensitivities.ExperienceAt least 3 years of experience as a data scientist or data analyst in developing data analytics models/solutions as well as working in a data science team.

title: Data Analyst
description: Who We AreWow the World! Spark Excitement in Everyone! gumi Asia aims to Wow the World by bravely continuing to challenge the latest trends and technologies. We aim to tackle difficulties with a pleasant and cheerful attitude, and to take full advantage of our business resources, collaborate actively not only within our team but also with you, the gamers!Our Mission to offer excitement to spread it from Japan to all over the world to link our users together to strive as one to challenge new thingsWe offer “Wow!”, “和 (WA: Japanese style)” and “輪 (WA: social network)” to the world.Core ValuesKeep on Trying!Stay Positive!Unite as One!The RoleWork alongside the game operations and marketing team to collect and analyse key data metrics to make strategic business decisionsAnalyse marketing-specific data and proactively make recommendations to the User Acquisition team for improved performance marketingAnalyse game-specific data and proactively make recommendations to Producers, Game Designers, Developers, Artists and UX DesignersMonitor and provide reporting from key metrics across gumi Asia Develop new insights and analyses to support in making informed decisions to improve gameplayWork with back end developers to define data pointsDevelop and improve on weekly reports for Game Producers and for Headquarters Ideal ProfileHave minimum 2 years’ experience in Data Management, Consolidation and Analysis preferred.Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and MySQLPossess strong business acumen, and able to research and engage stakeholders to explore data solutions to facilitate business requirements.Candidates with more experience may be considered for Senior Data Analyst positionWhat's on Offer?Opportunity to make a positive impact

title: Data Analyst
description: ResponsibilitiesRole To provide data analytics and customer insight support to drive engagement and customer lifetime value. The role works closely with the Data Science, Campaign & Rewards sub teams as a function of the Customer Lifecycle Management division.Analytics: Conduct monthly deep dives on consumer segment performance (Sub-base, ARPU, Revenue and margins) with second level insights on product performance by consumer segments.  Define, measure, and communicate key performance indicators for consumer segment.  Perform complex analysis and hypotheses by segment for multiple products and GTM activities, with the goal of maximizing revenue and market share while keeping cost per sale low.  Assist in segment GTM by identifying key drivers for business case/sponsorship as well as post mortem campaign evaluation  Monitor market trends and identify usage behavior to drive promotional ideas/collaboration  Provide actionable recommendations for opportunities that support business objectives identified through ongoing program and customer measurement. Planning: Promote consumer segment interests. Support the development of customer-centric marketing and analyses.  Developing relevant, distinctive and innovative marketing strategies to drive sales and retention among targeted segments  Cross functional collaborations with Product and Finance on market needs for new product creation, Digital, Sales and Customer Care team in driving compelling GTM plans. Requirements Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, Economics or similar field with at least 3-4 years of analytical work experience  Prior experience using SQL and Tableau or a similar tool  Knowledge in Python would be advantageous  Strong Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint skills  Flair for numbers and has strong analytical skills  Able to handle big data sets  Able to work independently and a team player We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: 2022 Market Data Analyst Graduate Program - Singapore
description: Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Global Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets.In Global Data, you will apply your problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes, establish links with key players in the financial market by providing exceptional client support, and manage the financial data that feeds the Bloomberg Terminal.As a Data Analyst, you have the opportunity to develop subject matter expertise on a specific product while utilizing your technical abilities to improve data management processes.Analysts have a platform to move from one product to the other, every few years, based on their interests throughout their career in Global Data. There is growth potential within the department to take on more senior data analyst, data scientist or leadership roles.The Role:Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and business insight, as well as strong communication and ability to build relationships. They use these skills to extract, transform and load timely, accurate and comprehensive data accessible to our clients across various Bloomberg platforms. They play a key role in evolving our products and processes, which makes the role challenging and entrepreneurial. Assisting our clients with their data queries is also key to the role.We'll trust you to: Utilise a variety of software solutions to extract and rationalise data to Bloomberg taxonomies Provide in-depth customer support to users of Bloomberg products by resolving inquiries in a timely manner Implement business rules for programmatic data validation by codifying market conventions and/or data relationships Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as acquisition, worklist management, and quality control Build subject matter expertise and technical skills to generate premium content, including data-driven news stories Analyse internal processes to identify opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set Utilise statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required Partner with a wide variety of stakeholders from Engineering to Sales on product developmentThis is an entry level role where you'll need to have: A Bachelor's degree (or above) preferably with combined studies in Information Systems and Finance, or related business and STEM fields or relevant experience in Finance & Technology, and the ability to join a training class in 2022 (Candidates graduating between June 2021 to September 2022) A demonstrated interest in financial markets and technology along with the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry (example: course of degree or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Proficiency in Python, SQL or R, demonstrated through school projects or work experience Understanding and experience of Statistics, or Data Modelling, or Data Analysis Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Eagerness to learn and collaborate with teams across regions and products Solid attention to detail and experience in problem solving through school/work/internship Ability to think creatively and provide solutions which improves process efficiency Resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Ability to communicate effectively and articulate thought process clearly Business proficiency and fluency in EnglishWe'd love to see: Exposure to Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service Established presence in virtual development communities such as GitHub, Stack Overflow and HackerRank Familiarity with Data Science and/or Machine Learning Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSenseThis is a future opportunity in our 2022 graduate hiring program.Does this sound like you?This is an entry level role. Apply if you think we're a good match. Please note this is a two stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment.Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status.As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.

title: Data Analyst (Python)
description: Telepathy Labswas founded in 2016 as an AI company with the ambition of integrating AI into legacy businesses to help enterprises better manage their complex workflows and business structures. With our headquarters in the US, we now have 3 offices globally (Zurich and Singapore). Our technology revolves around these core philosophies - Innovation, Creativity and a Passion for improving performance to drive our company and our people forward.In Telepathy, we value our employees and provide them with the right resources and tools they need to help them achieve their goals and grow with us.Are you looking to make a difference in a fast-growing company? Come join us!Job DescriptionImplement techniques in Python for data wrangling, quality review, anomaly detection and handling.Ingest customer data, performing necessary data transformations optimized for downstream tasks such as analytics and reporting.Design and implement test frameworks, perform unit testing and end-to-end testing.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.Follow adopted industry standards and agile development practices to accommodate rapid customer-driven specification changes.Coordinate with engineering team for integration, testing and debugging.Job RequirementsMust Have 3+ years work experience writing software in Python and extensive knowledge and experience using pandas, spacy, regular expressions.Must Have 3+ years working experience in one or more fields in Data Science/Analytics, Data Engineering, NLP.Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or any other technology related field with knowledge of Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Software Engineering.Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB.Experience with SDLC, and knowledge of testing and automation frameworks.Ability to work and collaborate with remotely located teams in different time zones.Detail-oriented, motivated and self-managing.DesirableExperience with AWS/Azure environments.Experience with NiFi.Experience with Graph databases.Proficient in MS Excel.

title: Data Analyst
description: Key Responsibilities Design, develop and maintain ETL pipelines, jobs, reports, visualizations, dashboards, etc. that support requirements from various business departments. Design, develop and maintain data acquisition pipelines including integration to external data sources and crawlers. Develop adhoc queries or data processing scripts to answer business questions raised by the business team as required. Assist in other more sophisticated data tasks as required.Compulsory Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master's degree in IT, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a related discipline. Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply. Good knowledge in fundamentals of data processing. Good knowledge in basics of statistics and probability theory. Good Python coding skills including the use of numpy, pandas and matplotlib libraries as a must. Good Java or Scala coding skills. Good knowledge in the HTTP protocol and basics of HTML/CSS/Javascript. Experience in development of web-app, API service, or daemon service using Java or Python. Familiar with queries in relational databases such as MS SQL, and NoSQL databases including key-value stores, document stores and columnar stores. Familiar with visualisation tools such as Excel, PowerBI etc. Effective communication with both technical and business team.Preferred Qualifications Good experience in data warehouse design, NoSQL store design and ETL pipeline design. Good experience in streaming processing using cloud-native or open-source frameworks such as Spark, Flink, Storm etc. Good experience in big data processing and storage in either batch style, mini-batch style or streaming style. Good experience in cloud-native data products from Azure or AWS, including data storages and data processing engines. Good experience in machine learning modelling, including classic methods and deep learning methods. Good experience in using distancing and clustering algorithms. Good experience in using Linux system, containerisation, and DevOps best practices. Good experience in solving a dynamic optimisation problem. Good experience in transportation or logistics domain.
